faucius: <entryFree id="n17807" type="main" key="Fauci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faucĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n17807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman gens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n17807.1" n="II" level="1"> Curia Faucia, a part of the Roman Curia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fauna: <entryFree id="n17808" type="main" key="Fauna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fauna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the prophesying sister of Faunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> Bona Dea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faunalia: <entryFree id="n17809" type="main" key="Fauna_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Faunus, II. B.</entryFree>
faunigena: <entryFree id="n17810" type="main" key="Fauni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Faunus+gigno</etym>, <sense id="n17810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">descended from Faunus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 7</bibl>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunĭgĕnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">descendants of Faunus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 358</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faunius: <entryFree id="n17811" type="main" key="Fauni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunĭus</orth>, see the follg. art. II. A.</entryFree>
faunus: <entryFree id="n17812" type="main" key="Faunus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>faveo</etym>, <sense id="n17812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythic son of Picus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandson of Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Latinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Latium; he instituted tillage and grazing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and after death was the protecting deity of agriculture and of shepherds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also a giver of oracles; after the introduction of the worship of Pan into Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he was identified with Pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and accordingly represented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like the latter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with horns and goats' feet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:193" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 193</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 312</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:H. 5:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18, 1</bibl> et saep. On account of the assimilation of Faunus to Pan, the appellation Fauni was also used for Panes, <hi rend="ital">sylvan deities</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 392</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 193</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 244</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 222 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17812.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n17812.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> Faunus: versus, Victorinn. p. 2586 P.—</sense><sense id="n17812.3" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faunālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival celebrated on the nones of December</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in honor of Faunus</hi>, acc. to Porphyr. and Acro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 1</bibl> and 10.</sense></entryFree>
fausta: <entryFree id="n17813" type="main" key="Fausta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fausta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Faustus.</entryFree>
fauste: <entryFree id="n17814" type="main" key="fauste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">luckily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorably</hi>, v. 1. faustus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
faustianus: <entryFree id="n17815" type="main" key="Fausti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Faustus.</entryFree>
faustina: <entryFree id="n17816" type="main" key="Fausti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n17816.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of the emperor Antoninus Pius</hi>, Capit. Anton. Pius, 1.—</sense><sense id="n17816.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of the emperor Antoninus Philosophus</hi>, Capit. Anton. Phil. 6.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustīnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> Faustina: puellae, Capit. Anton. Phil. 26: SCHOLA, <hi rend="ital">for the use of the</hi> puellae Faustinianae, Inscr. Or. 1895.</sense></entryFree>
faustitas: <entryFree id="n17817" type="main" key="Fausti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>faustus</etym>, <sense id="n17817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">happy condition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happiness;</hi> as a goddess, the personified <hi rend="ital">Fertility</hi> of the soil: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrit rura Ceres almaque Faustitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faustulus: <entryFree id="n17818" type="main" key="Faustu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shepherd who brought up Romulus and Remus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 854 al.</bibl>—Facete, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faustus: <entryFree id="n17819" type="main" key="faustus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for favostus, from faveo; lit., favorable; hence</etym>, <sense id="n17819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of favorable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortunate omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">felix, fortunatus, beatus, prosperus, dexter, secundus): quae (omina) majores nostri quia valere censebant, idcirco omnibus rebus agendis: QVOD BONVM FAVSTVM FELIX FORTVNATVMQVE ESSET praefabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 102</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut nobis haec habitatio Bona, fausta, felix fortunataque eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utile sit faustumque precor, quod imagine somni Vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 448</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 785 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus ut classi felix faustusque daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i pede fausto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoles Nutrita faustis sub penetralibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o faustum et felicem hunc diem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o nox illa fausta huic urbi!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 41, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi tempestas indulget tempore fausto,</quote> <trans><tr>favorable</tr>, <tr>suitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 805</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">fauste</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">favorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eis quoque hominibus ea res fauste, feliciter prospereque eveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17820" type="main" key="Faustus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustus</orth>. <sense id="n17820.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of</hi> L. Cornelius Sulla, <hi rend="ital">the son of the dictator</hi>, also called<pb n="731" /> <cb n="FAVE" />  Faustus Sulla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 13, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17820.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Faustĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Faustus Sulla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Faustian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager, that produced excellent wine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Fer. Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Fer. Als. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17820.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fausta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of</hi> Sulla, <hi rend="ital">wife of</hi> Milo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17820.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poor tragedian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fautor: <entryFree id="n17821" type="main" key="fautor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fautor</orth> (uncontr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">făvĭtor</orth>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 78</bibl> and 79; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 1</bibl>, acc. to Cod. Erf.), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>faveo</etym>, <sense id="n17821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a favorer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furtherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patron</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17821.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ego dignitatis ab adulescentia fautor (with adjutor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 25, 3: multi fautores laudis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosi et fautores illius victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">clamor ab utriusque fautoribus oritur,</quote> <trans><tr>from the partisans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">competitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cultor bonorum (populus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inepte (i. q. inepte favens) Lucili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">veterum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes illi fautores illius flagitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17821.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: favitorem tibi me, amicum, amatorem putes, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 23</bibl>: aetati facieque tuae se Fautorem ostendat, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tam multos et bonos viros ejus (Plancii) honori viderem esse favitores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17821.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute ambire oportet, non favitoribus: Sat habet favitorum semper, qui recte facit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>applauders</tr>, <tr>claqueurs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 78 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 78 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fautrix: <entryFree id="n17822" type="main" key="fautrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fautrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fautor</etym>, <sense id="n17822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a patroness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protectress</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n17822.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae non modo fautrices fidelissimae, sed etiam effectrices sunt voluptatum tam amicis quam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio fautrix suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 101</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17822.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestra auctoritas meae auctoritati fautrix adjutrixque sit, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 40: Thais nostrae omni et fautrix familiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 22</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faux: <entryFree id="n17823" type="gloss" key="faux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faux</orth>, v. fauces.</entryFree>
favea: <entryFree id="n17824" type="hapax" key="fa^ve^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>faveo</etym>, <sense id="n17824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a favorite female slave</hi> (= <foreign lang="greek">paidi/skh</foreign>, Gloss.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faventia: <entryFree id="n17825" type="main" key="fa^venti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făventĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being favorable</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">keeping silence</hi> at religious ceremonies: faventiam bonam ominationem significat. Nam praecones clamantes populum sacrificiis <hi rend="ital">favere</hi> jubebant, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=88:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 88, 6</bibl> Müll.: augustam adhibebant faventiam, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 206, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(ore obsceno dicta segregent, Non.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17826" type="main" key="Fa^venti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făventĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">which produced excellent linen cloth</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Faënza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:598" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 598</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17826.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv. </sense><sense id="n17826.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făventīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Faventia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Faventine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17826.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făventīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Faventia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
faveo: <entryFree id="n17827" type="main" key="fa^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvĕo</orth>, <itype>fāvi, fautum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>perh. root <foreign lang="greek">fav-, fa/os, fw=s</foreign>, light, safety; cf. also foveo</etym>, <sense id="n17827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be well disposed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inclined towards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befriend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countenance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi> (class.; syn.: studeo, foveo, diligo, amo). </sense><sense id="n17827.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17827.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">favere et cupere Helvetiis propter eam affinitatem (opp. odisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui diligebant hunc, illi favebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">favor, II.: ille (chorus) bonis faveatque et consilietur amice (= semper cum personis probis stet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 196</bibl></cit>: Romanis Juno coepit placata favere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 281</bibl> (Ann. v. 289 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi favemus, te tuā frui virtute cupimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescripsi ... me ei fauturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multo plus patriae faveo quam tuae gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae, dignitati ac gloriae tuae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae laudi dignitatique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic meae voluntati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honori et dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus Gallicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: favere et plaudere ingeniis sepultis, Hor. Ep. <cb n="FAVI" /> 2, 1, 88: <cit><quote lang="la">operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 367</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc coëamus ait ... Coëamus retulit Echo, et verbis favet ipsa suis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>delights in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 388</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (galli) silentio noctis, ut ait Ennius, favent faucibus russis cantu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>give rest to</tr>, <tr>indulge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo non invidetur illi aetati, verum etiam favetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 13, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">favetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl>: huic Romae ita fautum est, ut, etc., Spartian. Pescenn. 2.—</sense><sense id="n17827.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">maxime favet judex qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">judices, ut faveant, rogamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si favet alma Pales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:722" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assis, o Tegeaee, favens (= propitius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe, fave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faveas, Cypria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis es, o faveas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 613</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, o, coetum, Tyrii, celebrate faventes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 735</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favente Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faventibus diis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et bonos et aequos et faventes vos habui dominos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17827.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (= cupere): matronae moeros complent spectare faventes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 376 ed. Vahl., but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 100</bibl>, v. Loers. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n17827.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) altera frumentis favet, altera Baccho, densa magis Cereri, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is favorable</tr>, <tr>promotes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum favet nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti faventes (i. q. secundi, prosperi),</quote> <trans><tr>favorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17827.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17827.7" n="A" level="2"> In relig. lang., linguis, rarely linguā, ore, etc., <hi rend="ital">to speak good words</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to abstain from evil words</hi> (the Greek <foreign lang="greek">eu)fhmei=n</foreign>); hence, <hi rend="ital">to keep still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be silent</hi>: idcirco rebus divinis, quae publice fierent, ut FAVERENT LINGVIS imperabatur; <cit><quote lang="la">inque feriis imperandis, ut LITIBVS ET IVRGIIS SE ABSTINERENT,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faventia bonam ominationem significat. Nam praecones clamantes populum sacrificiis FAVERE jubebant. Favere enim est bona fari: at veteres poëtae pro silere usi sunt favere, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. faventia. p. 88, 6 Müll.: vidimus certis precationibus custodem praeponi, qui faveri linguis jubeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 83</bibl>: prospera lux oritur: linguis animisque favete; <cit><quote lang="la">Nunc dicenda bono sunt bona verba die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicamus bona verba, venit natalis, ad aras. Quisquis ades, linguā vir mulierque fave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">en deus est, deus est! linguis animisque favete, quisquis ades! dixit ... Quisquis adest, jussum veneratur numen, et omnes Verba sacerdotis referunt geminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:677 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 677 sq.</bibl></cit>: contecti gladiis sub scutis ore faventes (= tacentes), Enn. ap. Phil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 230</bibl> (Ann. v. 415 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ore favete omnes et cingite tempora ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odi profanum vulgus et arceo. Favete linguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties mentio sacra litterarum intervenerit, favete linguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra facit vates? sint ora faventia sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concipiamque bonas ore favente preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:13:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā favens assit (diei natali), longorum oblita malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 83</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mente favete pari, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:295" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 295</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">favete (= tacete), adeste aequo animo et rem cognoscite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17827.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To applaud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo clamor vocat et turba faventium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum clamore, qualis ex insperato faventium solet, Romani adjuvant militem suum (Horatium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infensus turbae faventi adversus studium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu Veneri dominae plaude favente manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faveria: <entryFree id="n17828" type="main" key="Fa^ve^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făvĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Istria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
favilla: <entryFree id="n17829" type="main" key="fa^villa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root bhā-, to shine; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa-, fw=s</foreign>, etc., cf. Lat. fax</etym>, <sense id="n17829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hot cinders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing ashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embers</hi> (cf. cinis). </sense><sense id="n17829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): ibi favillae plena coquendo sit faxo (psaltria). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillas agere ac late differre favillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 675</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 80</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cum contectus ignis ex se favillam discutit scintillamque emittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 84, § 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e carbone restincto favilla digito sublata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 72, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis e favilla et carbonibus ad calefaciendum triclinium illatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil invenit praeter tepidam in ara favillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 18</bibl></cit>: vi pulveris ae favillae oppressus<cb n="FAVO" />  est. (Plinius), Suet. Fragm. Hist., ed. Roth, p. 301.—</sense><sense id="n17829.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the ashes of the dead</hi> still glowing: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis favillam ab reliquo separant cinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 11, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi tu calentem Debita sparges lacrima favillam Vatis amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:561" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 561</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17829.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <trans><tr>powder of salt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 90</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17829.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a glimmering spark</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">origin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est venturi prima favilla mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
favillaceus: <entryFree id="n17830" type="main" key="fa^villa_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvillācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>favilla</etym>, <sense id="n17830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like ashes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fuligo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35</bibl></cit>; cf. the follg. art.</sense></entryFree>
favillaticus: <entryFree id="n17831" type="main" key="fa^villa_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvillātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like ashes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
favillesco: <entryFree id="n17832" type="main" key="fa^villesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvillesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to be reduced to ashes</hi> (late Lat.): <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Contin. Verg. p. 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
favisae: <entryFree id="n17833" type="main" key="favi_sae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">favīsae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">favissae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n17833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underground reservoirs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cellars near the temples</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for water</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for sacred utensils no longer in use</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v., p. 88, 4 Müll.; cf.: favissae, <foreign lang="greek">qhsauroi/</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
favitor: <entryFree id="n17834" type="main" key="fa^vi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. fautor <sense id="n17834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
favonialis: <entryFree id="n17835" type="gloss" key="fa^vo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Favonius, I. B.</entryFree>
favonius: <entryFree id="n17836" type="main" key="Fa^vo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făvōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>faveo</etym>. <sense id="n17836.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The west wind</hi>, also called Zephyrus, <hi rend="ital">which blew at the commencement of spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and promoted vegetation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:93" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 25, 39, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:337" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 34, 77, § 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17836.1" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">făvōnĭālis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">*zefu/rios</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n17836.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman proper name.</hi> So esp. M. Favonius, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cicero and an imitator of M. Cato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence he received the derisive sobriquet of</hi> simius Catonis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17836.3" n="B" level="2"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Făvōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Favonius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Favonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
favor: <entryFree id="n17837" type="main" key="fa^vor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partiality</hi>, esp. of a party (rare in Cic.; not in Caes.; freq. since the Aug. per. in prose and poetry; syn.: studium, benevolentia, gratia, pietas, caritas, amor). </sense><sense id="n17837.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n17837.2" n="A" level="2"> Of human beings: <cit><quote lang="la">favorem et urbanum Cicero nova credit. Nam in epistola ad Brutum, Eum, inquit, amorem et eum (ut hoc verbo utar) favorem in consilium advocabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui favore populi tenetur et ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">under II.: quae sunt varie et ad tempus descripta populis, favore magis quam re, legum nomen tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplecti aliquem favore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex maxima invidia in gratiam et favorem nobilitatis Jugurtha venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 73:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 56, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">partium Pompeii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:54:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilia to populi favore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro laborantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17837.3" n="B" level="2"> Rarely of Fortune: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae favor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:72:4" default="NO">72, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17837.4" n="C" level="2"> Favor personified as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 48 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17837.5" n="D" level="2"> Esp., legal t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">favoris causa, said where the law inclines to or encourages a particular right or practice: hoc favoris causa constitutum est, ut pro plenis (honoribus) incoätos accipiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:74" default="NO">23, 3, 74</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">favor libertatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 2</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n17837.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">acclamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi>, at theatrical and other exhibitions (syn. plausus), <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod studium et quem favorem secum in scenam attulit Panurgus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere favorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promere favorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emerendi favoris gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno omnium favore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plauditur et magno palma favore datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:506" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutatur favor Euryalum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 343</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
favorabilis: <entryFree id="n17838" type="main" key="fa^vo_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>favor</etym>. <sense id="n17838.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Favored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved</hi> (not anteAug.; perh. first in Vell.; v. the follg.): Luculli et Metelli triumphum invidia Pompeii apud optimum quemque fecit favorabilem,<pb n="732" /> <cb n="FAX" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">reditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid invidiosum, favorabile, etc. ... sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis ac favorabilis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:9" default="NO">4, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in civitate minime favorabili natus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquem favorabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17838.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Winning favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">est enim jucunda auribus ac favorabilis elcquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorabilius et tutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorabiliores fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">făvōrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with applause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approbation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem laetum ac plausibilem locum quam maxime possint favorabiliter excurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:10" default="NO">40, 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
favorabiliter: <entryFree id="n17839" type="main" key="fa^vo_ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvōrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. preced. <sense id="n17839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
favoratus: <entryFree id="n17840" type="main" key="fa^vo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [unused favoro], <sense id="n17840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">favored</hi>: a sancto episcopo, Pseud.<bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ad Fratr. Erem. Serm. 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
favorinus: <entryFree id="n17841" type="main" key="Fa^vo_ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Făvōrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman philosopher in the time of Trajan and Hadrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:5 al" default="NO">2, 12, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
favus: <entryFree id="n17842" type="main" key="fa^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">făvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n17842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a honey-comb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17842.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">favus est, quem fingunt (apes) multicavatum e cera, cum singula cava sena latera habeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:57" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 344</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 678</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 14, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">Crescere tamquam favum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>imperceptibly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43</bibl></cit> and 76.—</sense><sense id="n17842.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hexagonal stone in a pavement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fax: <entryFree id="n17843" type="main" key="fax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fax</orth>, <itype>făcis</itype> (also in the <sense id="n17843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> ‡ faces, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 9</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi>: facum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 113</bibl> P., but without example), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root bhā, to shine; cf. favilla</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a torch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firebrand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flambeau</hi>, <hi rend="ital">link</hi>, orig. of pine or other resinous wood. </sense><sense id="n17843.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn.: taeda, funale, cerĕus, candela, lucerna, laterna): alii faces atque aridam materiem de muro in aggerem eminus jaciebant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulare cum facibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolos et faces ad inflammandam urbem comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego faces jam accensas ad hujus urbis incendium exstinxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi in tecta nostra cum facibus immissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">faces incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te in Capitolium faces ferre vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardentem facem praeferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">subdere urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces ferro inspicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 292</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facis incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 63, § 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilapsam in cineres facem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 28</bibl></cit>.—At weddings, <hi rend="ital">the torch carried before the bride on the way to her home</hi>, usually made of white-thorn (Spina alba) or pine, <hi rend="ital">the nuptial torch</hi>: spina, nuptiarum facibus auspicatissima, Masur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 75</bibl>; Fest. s. v. patrimi, p. 245; s. v. rapi, p. 289 Müll.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 27</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:98 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 98 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:259 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 259 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, nuptiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 13, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 356</bibl></cit>.—Cf. Anthon's Dict. of Antiq. p. 434, and <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. Torches were also carried in funeral processions, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:561" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 561</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 21, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11</bibl>; id. Vit. Beat. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 222</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the Eleusinian mysteries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:140" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 140</bibl></cit>.—An attribute of Cupid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:82" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl> (4, 15), 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 461</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 312 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Furies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 337</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 482</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">508</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:47 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 47 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17843.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17843.3" n="1" level="3"> On account of the use of torches at weddings (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">a wedding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">face nuptiali digna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te face sollemni junget sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 49</bibl></cit>.—And referring at the same time to the funeral torch: <cit><quote lang="la">viximus insignes inter utramque facem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>between marriage and death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 46.—</sense><sense id="n17843.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The light</hi> of the heavenly bodies (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dum roseā face sol inferret lumina caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:976" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 976</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi fax, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18: canentes Rite crescentem face Noctilucam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterna fax,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 835" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 835</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17843.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fiery meteor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire-ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shooting-star</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctivagaeque faces caeli flammaeque volantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1191</bibl></cit>; <cb n="FEBR" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnasque faces caeli, sublime volantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emicant et faces non nisi cum decidunt visae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum facibus visis caelestibus, tum stellis iis, quas Graeci cometas, nostri cincinnatas vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 694</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 787</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 528</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oet. 232" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oet. 232</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17843.6" n="b" level="4"> Of <hi rend="ital">lightning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facem flammantem dirigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:569" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 569</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:671" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 671</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17843.7" n="4" level="3"> Of the eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi, geminae, sidera nostra, faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has ego credo faces, haec virginis ora Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:380" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 380</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillaeque faces oculis et plurima vultu materinest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:164" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17843.8" n="5" level="3"> Prima fax (noctis), <hi rend="ital">early torchlight</hi>, immediately after dark (post-class.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luminibus accensis, Auct. B. Afr. 89: tempus diei occiduum, mox suprema tempestas, hoc est diei novissimum tempus: deinde vespera: ab hoc tempore prima fax dicitur, deinde concubia, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S, 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:1" default="NO">18, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 20</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n17843.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17843.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which illuminates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">makes conspicuous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">incipit parentum nobilitas facem praeferre pudendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 139</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17843.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which inflames</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause of ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum corporis facibus inflammari soleamus ad omnes fere cupiditates eoque magis incendi, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me torret face mutua Calais,</quote> <trans><tr>flame of love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">iraï fax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi faces,</quote> <trans><tr>flames</tr>, <tr>fires of eloquence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui quasi quasdam verborum faces admovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui acriores ad studia dicendi faces subdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">hortator studii causaque faxque mei,</quote> <trans><tr>guide</tr>, <tr>leader</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; and: incitator et fax omnium, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 67: <cit><quote lang="la">subicere faces invidiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantibus jam militum animis velut faces addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimam bello facem praetulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rogationes promulgavit) duas faces novantibus res ad plebem in optimates accendendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde faces ardent, a dote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 139</bibl></cit>: adolescentulo ad libidinem facem praeferre, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be a leader</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius omnium Clodi incendiorum fax,</quote> <trans><tr>instigator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fax accusationis et origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax hujus belli (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorum cum admoventur faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dolor) ardentes faces intentat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (Agrippinae) Gaium et Domitium Neronem principes genuere totidem facis generis humani,</quote> <trans><tr>destroyers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 45</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum his furiis et facibus, cum his exitiosis prodigiis (i e. Gabinio et Pisone),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
faxim: <entryFree id="n17844" type="main" key="faxim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">faxim</orth>, <itype>faxo</itype>, <sense id="n17844.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref targOrder="U">facio</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
febrarius: <entryFree id="n17845" type="main" key="Febra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Febrārĭus</orth>, v. Februarius.</entryFree>
febresco: <entryFree id="n17846" type="main" key="febresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [febris], <hi rend="ital">to catch a fever</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
febribilis: <entryFree id="n17847" type="main" key="febri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that easily produces fever</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
febricito: <entryFree id="n17848" type="main" key="fe_^bri_ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fē^brīcĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be ill of a fever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a fever</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">scire oportet, non febricitare eum, cujus venae naturaliter ordinatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
febricosus: <entryFree id="n17849" type="main" key="febri^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a fever</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
febricula: <entryFree id="n17850" type="main" key="febri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight fever</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">febriculam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: in febriculam incidere, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentis febriculis diu detineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
febriculentus: <entryFree id="n17851" type="main" key="febri_cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrīcŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a fever</hi> (late Lat.), Marc. Empir. 22.</sense></entryFree>
febriculosus: <entryFree id="n17852" type="main" key="febri_cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrīcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17852.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Feverish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sick of a fever</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17852.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing fever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">febrific</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Or. 1</bibl> ed. Mai.</sense></entryFree>
febrifugia: <entryFree id="n17853" type="main" key="febri^fu^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrĭfŭgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>febris + fugo</etym>, <sense id="n17853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called also centaurea, <hi rend="ital">the centaury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
febrio: <entryFree id="n17854" type="main" key="febri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>febris</etym>, <sense id="n17854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be ill of a fever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a fever</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">si non febrit, venter solvendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:38:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl>. <cb n="FEBR" /></sense></entryFree>
febris: <entryFree id="n17855" type="main" key="fe_^bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fē^bris</orth> (the ē predominating in poets), is (acc. <number>sing.</number>: <sense id="n17855.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">febrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 294</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Pseud. 2, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 17, § 37</bibl> Jan. et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or: febre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 1, 4</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:218 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 218 al.</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for fer-bris, root bhar-, to be hot, v. ferveo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a fever.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17855.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: appellamus a calendo calorem, e fervore febrim, Varr. ap. <bibl
