default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui venae sic moventur, hic habet febrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 8, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">febrim habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestu febrique jactari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Romam venisse cum febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum febri domum rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febri carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, in an altered construction: caruitne febris te heri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sine febri laborassem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in febri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:36:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in febrim subito incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febre liberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febri liberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 71, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febre corripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febre calere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem torret olim domestica febris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at home in him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigili cum febre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:229" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquit eum febris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 4, 52</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, ne tertianas quoque febres et quartanas divinas esse dicendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres aliae ab horrore incipiunt, aliae a frigore, aliae a calore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidae febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opella forensis Adducit febres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17855.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Febris</orth>, personified as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with three temples in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the principal of which was on the</hi> Palatium, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of the</hi> Velabrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Febri divae, Febri sanctae, Febri magnae, Camilla pro filio amato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> p. 97, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17855.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a source of uneasiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certo scio, nunc febrim tibi esse, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
februa: <entryFree id="n17856" type="main" key="Fe_bru^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēbrŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. februum.</entryFree>
februalis: <entryFree id="n17857" type="main" key="Febru^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Febrŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Februum.</entryFree>
februamentum: <entryFree id="n17858" type="hapax" key="febru^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrŭāmentum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen> <etym>februo</etym>, <sense id="n17858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a religious purification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
februarius: <entryFree id="n17859" type="main" key="Fe^bru^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĕbrŭārĭus</orth> (in Inscr. sometimes written FEBRARIVS), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĕbrŭāri-us mensis</orth> <etym>februum</etym>, <sense id="n17859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the month of expiation</hi> (because on the 15th of this month the great feast of expiation and purification, Februa, was held), <hi rend="ital">February</hi>, until the time of the decemvirs the last month of the Roman year, since then the second: <cit><quote lang="la">ab diis inferis Februarius appellatus, quod tum his parentetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:31 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 31 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 6</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll., v. februum.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonis Februariis,</quote> <trans><tr>of February</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Idibus Februariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:18:30:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
februata: <entryFree id="n17860" type="main" key="Februa_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Februāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. februum.</entryFree>
februatio: <entryFree id="n17861" type="main" key="febru^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>februo</etym>, <sense id="n17861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a religious purification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
februatus: <entryFree id="n17862" type="main" key="Februatus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Februatus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. februum and februo.</entryFree>
februlis: <entryFree id="n17863" type="main" key="Februlis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Februlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. februum.</entryFree>
februo: <entryFree id="n17864" type="main" key="febru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">febrŭo</orth>, no <sense id="n17864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>februum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to purify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiate</hi> (ante-class.): in eorum sacris liba cum sint facta, inicere solent farris semina ac dicere, se ea februare, id est pura facere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl> Müll., and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85:13 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85, 13 sq.</bibl> Müll.; v. also februum.</sense></entryFree>
februum: <entryFree id="n17865" type="main" key="fe_bru^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēbrŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> Orig., in the Sabine lang., <sense id="n17865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purgation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">means of purification.</hi>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">februa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Roman festival of purification and expiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated on the 15th of the month hence called February</hi> (v. Februarius); whence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Februālis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Febrūlis</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Februāta</orth>, <hi rend="ital">surnames of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was worshipped at this festival;</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Februātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the festival itself;</hi> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Februus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Lupercus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who presided over this festival</hi>: Lupercalia dicta, quod in Lupercali luperci sacra faciunt. Rex cum ferias menstruas Nonis Februariis edicit, hunc diem Februatum appellat. Februum Sabini purgamentum, et id in sacris nostris verbum; <cit><quote lang="la">nam et Lupercalia februatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 343</bibl>: Ego arbitror Februarium a <pb n="733" /> <cb n="FECU" /> die Februato, quod tum februatur populus, id est lupercis nudis lustratur antiquum oppidum Palatinum gregibus humanis cinctum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § 34; cf. also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85:13 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85, 13 sq.</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Februa Romani dixere piamina patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 726</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 423</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno pulchra ... nam Fluoniam, Februalemque ac Februam mihi poscere non necesse est, cum nihil contagionis corporeae sexu intemerata pertulerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl></cit>: Februlis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85, 16</bibl> Müll.; Arnob. 3, p. 118 (dub. al. Februtis).</sense></entryFree>
fecialis: <entryFree id="n17866" type="main" key="Fe_ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēcĭālis</orth>, v. Fetialis.</entryFree>
fecula: <entryFree id="n17867" type="main" key="fe_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcŭla</orth>, v. faecula.</entryFree>
fecundator: <entryFree id="n17868" type="main" key="fe_cunda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcundātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fecundo</etym>, <sense id="n17868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who fertilizes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes fruitful</hi>: mulierum, Jul. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Contr. Jul. 6, 8, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fecunde: <entryFree id="n17869" type="main" key="fe_cunde"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcunde</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fecundus <sense id="n17869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fecunditas: <entryFree id="n17870" type="main" key="fe_cundi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcundĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fecundus</etym>, <sense id="n17870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fecundity</hi> (vegetable or animal). </sense><sense id="n17870.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17870.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">natura parem legem fecunditatis dixit virentibus atque hominibus ceterisque animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum inductionibus terris fecunditatem damus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunditatem importare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 248</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 44, 95, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 59, 79, § 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 27, § 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17870.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēcundĭtas</orth>, personified as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17870.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">plenty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Gallorum tantae fecunditatis juventus fuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluminum (Varronis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17870.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">volo se efferat in adolescente fecunditas,</quote> <trans><tr>luxuriance of style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl></cit>: magna animi, Plin. H. N. praef. § 5.</sense></entryFree>
fecundito: <entryFree id="n17871" type="gloss" key="fe_cundi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcundĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, = fecundo, <sense id="n17871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fertilize</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fecundo: <entryFree id="n17872" type="main" key="fe_cundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcundo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fecundus</etym>, <sense id="n17872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fertilize</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(Nilus) viridem Aegyptum nigrā fecundat arenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 293</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fecundus: <entryFree id="n17873" type="main" key="fe_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcundus</orth> (sometimes erroneously foecund-and faecund-, but v. Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 54, 8</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from ‡ feo, whence also fetus, femina, fenus, etc., cf. felix</etym>, <sense id="n17873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi> (of plants and animals).—Constr. with <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n17873.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fossiones agri repastinationesque, quibus fit multo terra fecundior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salices viminibus, frondibus ulmi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 446</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio fecunda fruticis exigui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus metallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: Amathus metallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 220</bibl></cit> Bach. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons silvae frequens fecundusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes fecundae et uberes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ocimo fecundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sue ... nihil genuit natura fecundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17873.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17873.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in</hi> any thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fecundi calices quem non fecere disertum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>copious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere fecundis collibus herbas,</quote> <trans><tr>plentifuliy furnished</tr>, <tr>thickly studded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:347" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecundissima gens,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in agricultural products</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(specus) Uberibus fecundus aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunda melle Calymne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera (Tityi) poenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>constantly renewed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Echidna, fecunda poenis viscera trahens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Tob. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigris Meroe fecunda colonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingula monstris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:470" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 470</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aemilium genus fecundum bonorum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17873.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Making fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertilizing</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 325</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipe fecundae patienter verbera dextrae, i. e. the blows with a thong of skin given to women by the luperci, and which were supposed to promote fruitfulness,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:427" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 427</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 343</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (Danaën) implevit fecundo Juppiter auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 698</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17873.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolific</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi> (class.): pectus, Cic. poët. Div. 1, <cb n="FELI" /> 13, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 338</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (Anaxagora) eum (Periclem), cum alia praeclara quaedam et magnifica didicisse, uberem et fecundum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo genera verborum: unum fecundum, quod declinando multas ex se parit dispariles formas, ut est lego, legis, legam, sic alia: alterum genus sterile, quod ex se parit nihil, ut est etiam, vix, cras, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 9</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">amor et melle et felle est fecundissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunda culpae saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:490" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecundum in fraudes hominum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vester porro labor fecundior, historiarum scriptores?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 98</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēcundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fruitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecundius poëmata ferrent fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 2</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">arundo recisa fecundius resurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 65, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantharides nascuntur fecundissime in fraxino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fedus: <entryFree id="n17874" type="main" key="fe_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēdus</orth>, v. haedus.</entryFree>
fel: <entryFree id="n17875" type="main" key="fel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fel</orth>, <itype>fellis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xo/los</foreign>, gall; cf. Germ. Galle; Engl. gall</etym>, <sense id="n17875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gall-bladder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bile</hi> (cf. bilis): <cit><quote lang="la">jecur a dextra parte sub praecordiis: ex inferiore parte ei fel inhaeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 74, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:119" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 10, 46, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 777</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinaceum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 75, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tobiae, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 19, 333</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vero Alcidae furiis exarserat atro Felle dolor, because the bile was regarded as the seat of rage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 220</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17875.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17875.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Poisonous liquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poison</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vipereum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagitta armata felle veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:857" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 857</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17875.3" n="2" level="3"> Fel terrae, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the lesser centaury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fumitory</hi> (Fumaria officinalis, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17875.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only in poets, whereas bilis is used in the trop. signif. also in good prose), <hi rend="ital">bitterness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acrimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animosity</hi> (syn.: bilis, stomachus, invidia, livor; <cit><quote lang="la">odium): amor et melle et felle est fecundissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corda felle sunt lita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia jam tristi tempora felle madent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
feles: <entryFree id="n17876" type="main" key="fe_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēles</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (in Varr. and Cic. faelis in best MSS.; <case>nom.</case> felis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 178</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root fe-, v. felix; prop., she that bears young</etym>, <sense id="n17876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii quamvis carnificinam prius subierint, quam aut faelem aut canem aut crocodilum violent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 73, 94, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:172" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 65, § 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:330 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 330 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17876.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a marten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polecat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17876.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who inveigles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mouser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seducer</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">feles virginalis,</quote> <trans><tr>girl - thief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feles virginaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
felicatus: <entryFree id="n17877" type="main" key="fe^li^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕlĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. filicatus.</entryFree>
felicitas: <entryFree id="n17878" type="main" key="fe_li_ci^tas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlīcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. felix</etym>. <sense id="n17878.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to felix, I.) <hi rend="ital">Fruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertility</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas major Babyloniae Seleuciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17878.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to felix, II.) <hi rend="ital">Happiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">felicity</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn.: fortuna, fors, sors, fatum): neque enim quicquam aliud est felicitas, nisi honestarum rerum prosperitas, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit felix, si potest ulla in scelere esse felicitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii fortuna felicitatem dedit, huic industria virtutem comparavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum est, ut de felicitate pauca dicamus,</quote> <trans><tr>good-fortune</tr>, <tr>luckiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic existimo in summo imperatore quatuor has res inesse oportere, scientiam rei militaris, virtutem, auctoritatem, felicitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitatem Helvetiorum bello esse perspectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut paulum ad summam felicitatem defuisse videretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo simul atque intus est itum, incredibili felicitate Auster in Africum se vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (mala) omnia subterfugere, non modo sapientiae, sed etiam felicitatis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi non et felicitas rerum gestarum exercitus benevolentiam imperatoribus, et res adversae odia concilient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae felicitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vis ipsa, quae saepe incredibiles huic urbi felicitates atque opes attulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17878.2" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="FELI" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēlīcĭtas</orth>, personified as <hi rend="ital">a deity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 4:18:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 4, 18, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17879" type="main" key="Fe_li_ci^tas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēlīcĭtas</orth> <itype>Julia</itype>, i. q. Olisipo, now <sense id="n17879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lisbon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
feliciter: <entryFree id="n17880" type="main" key="fe_li_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlīcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. felix <sense id="n17880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
felicito: <entryFree id="n17881" type="main" key="fe_li_ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlīcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>felix</etym>, <sense id="n17881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very happy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> Vit. Verg. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
felicula: <entryFree id="n17882" type="main" key="fe^li^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕlĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. filicula <sense id="n17882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
felineus: <entryFree id="n17883" type="main" key="fe_li_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. the follg. art.</entryFree>
felinus: <entryFree id="n17884" type="main" key="fe_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>feles</etym>, <sense id="n17884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a cat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 15</bibl></cit> dub. (Targa: suillum).—Another form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fē-līnĕus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 3, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
felio: <entryFree id="n17885" type="hapax" key="fe_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, expresses the cry of the male panther, Auct. Carm. Philom. 50.</entryFree>
felis: <entryFree id="n17886" type="main" key="fe_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. feles <sense id="n17886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
felix: <entryFree id="n17887" type="main" key="fe_lix1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> felici, except <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl>; and as nom. prop., v. II. B. 2. infra), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from root feo, fevo, to bear, produce, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fu/w</foreign>; cf.: fio, femina; whence fetus, fecundus, femina, fenus</etym>, <sense id="n17887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruit-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17887.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; not in Cic.): felices arbores Cato dixit, quae fructum ferunt, infelices quae non ferunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92, 10</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Amic. 2, 6</bibl> ed. Mai.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 81</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rami feliciores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of fruitful trees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massica Baccho,</quote> <trans><tr>fruitful in vines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 725</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Campania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicior regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 10, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">felix oleae tractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:711" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 711</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17887.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17887.3" n="1" level="3"> In the old relig. lang.: felices arbores, <hi rend="ital">all the nobler sorts of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose fruits were offered to the superior deities</hi>, in contradistinction to the infelices, which were dedicated to the inferior deities, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17887.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Felix</orth>, as an <hi rend="ital">adj. propr.</hi> in Arabia Felix, <hi rend="ital">the fertile portion of Arabia</hi>, opp. Arabia Deserta and Petraea; v. Arabia.—</sense><sense id="n17887.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17887.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that brings good luck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of good omen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">felicitous</hi> (orig. belonging to the relig. lang.; in the class. per. almost confined to poets; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: faustus, fortunatus, beatus, secundus): quae (omina) majores nostri quia valere censebant, idcirco omnibus rebus agendis: QVOD BONVM FAVSTVM FELIX FORTVNATVMQVE ESSET praefabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 102</bibl></cit>; so, QVOD BONVM FORTVNATVM FELIXQVE SALVTAREQVE SIET POPVLO ROMANO QVIRITIVM, etc., an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 86</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: ut nobis haec habitatio Bona, fausta, felix fortunataque eveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tibi mihique sit felix, sub imperium tuum redeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o dea ... Sis felix, nostrum leves, quaecumque, laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 330</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sis bonus o felixque tuis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque novas circum felix eat hostia fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">industria (corresp. to fertilis cura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3.—</sense><sense id="n17887.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (the predom. signif. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">exitus ut classi felix faustusque daretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polycratem Samium felicem appellabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Alexandriam se recepit, felix, ut sibi quidem videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ad casum fortunamque felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Graecus ab omni laude felicior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla felicissimus omnium ante civilem victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te retinendo fuit Asia felicior quam nos in deducendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:10:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 10, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam si minus felices in diligendo fuissemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vade, o felix nati pietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 480</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 785</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praxiteles quoque marmore fericior,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>succeeded better as a sculptor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices ter et amplius, Quos irrupta tenet copula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes composui. Felices! nunc ego resto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium felix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:312" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 312</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla sorte nascendi aetas felicior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicissima facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicissimus sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sim felix, a form of asseveration,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum, i. q. salubre,</quote> <trans><tr>salubrious</tr>, <tr>wholesome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 127</bibl></cit> Serv.—Prov.: felicem scivi, non qui quod <pb n="734" /> <cb n="FEMI" /> vellet haberet, sed qui per fatum non data non cuperet, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 319, 23 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17887.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Vergilius beatus felixque gratiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">7: o te, Bolane, cerebri Felicem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices studiique locique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix uteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:359" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:398" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:731" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices operum dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 277</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17887.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quo non felicior alter Ungueretela manu ferrumque armare veneno,</quote> <trans><tr>happier</tr>, <tr>more successful in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 772</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 284</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 126</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n17887.10" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gerund. dat.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tam felix vobis corrumpendis fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>successful in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēlīcĭter</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n17887.11" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Fruitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic segetes, illic veniunt felicius uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17887.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) </sense><sense id="n17887.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Auspiciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorably</hi>: quod mihi vobisque Quirites, Se fortunatim, feliciter ac bene vortat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 112 ed. Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea res mihi magistratuique meo, populo plebique Romanae bene atque feliciter eveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 3</bibl>.—In expressing a wish or in calling to a person, <hi rend="ital">Good luck!</hi> faciam quod volunt. Feliciter velim, inquam, teque laudo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 42, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feliciter, succlamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:30:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 30, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17887.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Luckily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">happily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successfully</hi> (most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sapientes semper feliciter, absolute, fortunate vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica et bene et feliciter gesta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui te feliciter attulit Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feliciter audet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob ea feliciter acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 2</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">feliciter sapit qui alieno periculo sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:305" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 305</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella cum finitimis felicissime multa gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:37:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit imitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: Horatius ... verbis felicissime audax, 10, 1, 96.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17888" type="main" key="Fe_lix2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēlix</orth> (with <case>abl.</case> Felice, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 67), <sense id="n17888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname of frequent occurrence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first applied to</hi> L. Sulla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 44, § 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17888.1" n="b" level="4"> Claudius Felix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17888.2" n="c" level="4"> Antonius Felix, <hi rend="ital">procurator of Judea and Galilee under Claudius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 23, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17888.3" n="d" level="4"> Julia Felix, i. q. Berytus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n17889" type="main" key="fe^lix3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. filix <sense id="n17889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fellator: <entryFree id="n17890" type="main" key="fella_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fello</etym>, <sense id="n17890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucker</hi>, in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:74" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:30" default="NO">11, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fellebris: <entryFree id="n17891" type="hapax" key="fellebris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellebris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sucking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
felleus: <entryFree id="n17892" type="main" key="felle^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fel</etym>, <sense id="n17892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of gall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of gall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like gall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 76, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fellico: <entryFree id="n17893" type="main" key="felli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fellĭto</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fello, like vellico from vello</etym>, <sense id="n17893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw by sucking</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mammas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
felliducus: <entryFree id="n17894" type="main" key="felli^du_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellĭdūcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fel-duco</etym>, <sense id="n17894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that carries off the gall</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4:63" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fellifluus: <entryFree id="n17895" type="main" key="felliflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">felliflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fel-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n17895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing with gall</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:19:188" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 19, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fellito: <entryFree id="n17896" type="main" key="felli^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. fellico.</entryFree>
fellitus: <entryFree id="n17897" type="main" key="felli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fel</etym>, <sense id="n17897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imbued with gall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steeped in gall</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n17897.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Avien. Epigr. in Anth. Lat. Burm. 1, p. 495" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> Avien. Epigr. in Anth. Lat. Burm. 1, p. 495</bibl></cit>: oculi, Pelag. Vet. 1.—</sense><sense id="n17897.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fello: <entryFree id="n17898" type="main" key="fello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fello</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n17898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suck</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n17898.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: lac humanum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 113, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 242, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17898.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> obsc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:50:1 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 50, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 71, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fellosus: <entryFree id="n17899" type="main" key="fello_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fellōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fel</etym>, <sense id="n17899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of gall</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6:91" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 6, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
felsina: <entryFree id="n17900" type="main" key="Felsi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Felsĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, i. q. Bononia, I.</entryFree>
femella: <entryFree id="n17901" type="hapax" key="fe_mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>femina</etym>, <sense id="n17901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young female</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
femellarius: <entryFree id="n17902" type="main" key="femella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">femellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>femella</etym>, <sense id="n17902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a follower of girls</hi>, i. q. mulierarius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
femen: <entryFree id="n17903" type="gloss" key="fe^men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. femur <sense id="n17903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
femina: <entryFree id="n17904" type="main" key="fe_mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from fe-, fev-, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fu/-w</foreign>, to produce; whence: fetus, fecundus, faenus, felix; cf. Sanscr. bhuas, bhavas, to become; Lat. fi-o, fu-turus</etym>, <sense id="n17904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17904.2" n="A" level="2"> Of human beings, <hi rend="ital">a female</hi>, <cb n="FEMI" /> <hi rend="ital">woman</hi> (cf.: uxor, mulier, matrona; <cit><quote lang="la">conjux, marita): ut a prima congressione maris et feminae ... ordiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mares deos et feminas esse dicitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus fuerit modo vir, modo femina Sithon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 280</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 819</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in claris viris et feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudine eximiā femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 25, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae notitiam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam feminarum omnem castitatem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissima omnium feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissima atque optima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta super jugandis feminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varium et mutabile semper femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc femina simplex,</quote> <trans><tr>the female character undisguised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:327" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 327</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quas Danai femina turba senis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 29), 4.—Applied as a term of reproach to effeminate men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 470</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:361" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 361</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n17904.3" n="B" level="2"> Of beasts, <hi rend="ital">a female</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bestiarum) aliae mares, aliae feminae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: lupus femina feta repente, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 355</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 70 and 73 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habendas triduum ferias et porco femina piaculum pati (shortly before, porca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 33, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 482</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 701</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17904.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the lang. of nat. hist., of plants and minerals: <cit><quote lang="la">mas in palmite floret, femina citra florem germinat tantum spicae modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>; ib. § 34; <cit><quote lang="la">so of other plants,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:145" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 34, 62, § 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">21, 10, 32, § 58 et saep.: in omni genere (carbunculorum) masculi appellantur acriores, et feminae languidius refulgentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the loadstone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 128</bibl></cit>.—In mechanics, cardo femina, different from cardo masculus (v. cardo, 2), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17904.5" n="III" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">the feminine gender</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO">1, 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
feminal: <entryFree id="n17905" type="main" key="fe_mi^nal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭnal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>femina</etym>, i. q. pudendum muliebre (an Appuleian word), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 11</bibl>; id. Mag., p. 296, 13.</entryFree>
feminalia: <entryFree id="n17906" type="main" key="fe^mi^na_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕmĭnālĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foem-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>femur</etym>, <sense id="n17906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bandages for the upper part of the thighs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thigh-bandages</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>; cf.: hoc genus vestimenti Graece <foreign lang="greek">periskelh/</foreign>, a nostris feminalia vel bracae usque ad genua pertinentes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ex. 28, 42 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
feminatus: <entryFree id="n17907" type="hapax" key="fe_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>femina</etym>, <sense id="n17907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made womanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: sic feminata virtus afflicta occidit, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 21, MSS. (Klotz and B. and K., ex conj., ecfeminata).</sense></entryFree>
femineus: <entryFree id="n17908" type="main" key="fe_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a woman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">womanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feminine</hi> (rare but class. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>) = muliebris. </sense><sense id="n17908.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae vir feminea interemor manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit> (in version of Soph. Trachin.): <cit><quote lang="la">femineae vocis exilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor ille quidem juvenes totidemque crearat Femineae sortis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the female sex</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:651" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 651</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:603" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 226</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:536" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 536</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 29: plangores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marte cadendum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by the hand of a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>love for a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>executed on a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 584</bibl></cit>: Calendae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the first of March</hi> (on which the Matronalia were celebrated), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceroma,</quote> <trans><tr>for women's use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 246</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17908.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with an accessory notion of contempt, <hi rend="ital">womanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmanly</hi>: vox, Quint, 1, 11, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 286</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae femineum et molle sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 101, 104, § 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
feminine: <entryFree id="n17909" type="main" key="fe_mi^ni_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭnīne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. femininus <sense id="n17909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
femininus: <entryFree id="n17910" type="main" key="fe_mi^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>femina</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n17910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the feminine gender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feminine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:14" default="NO">1, 6, 14</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae feminina positione mares significant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funis masculinum sit an femininum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 8, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:130" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 130</bibl>: persona, <cb n="FENE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 150</bibl>; 3, 24.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭnīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">femininely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the feminine gender</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P.; Fest. s. v. Petronia, p. 250, 15 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
femino: <entryFree id="n17911" type="main" key="fe_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>femina</etym>, <sense id="n17911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pollute one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:9:133" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 9, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
femorale: <entryFree id="n17912" type="main" key="fe^mo^ra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕmŏrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n17912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the thigh</hi> (late Lat. and very rare: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">feminalia),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 45, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
