cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calce feritur aselli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:755" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 755</bibl></cit>: uvas pede (rusticus), <hi rend="ital">to stamp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:85" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriri a serpente,</quote> <trans><tr>to be stung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 22, § 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:481" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 481</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera (venenata animalia) singulos feriunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam malleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: stricto ferit retinacula ferro, <hi rend="ital">cuts to pieces</hi> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">incidere funes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 580</bibl></cit>: certatim socii feriunt mare et aequora verrunt, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lash</hi> (in rowing), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 290</bibl>: ut frontem ferias, <hi rend="ital">that you may beat your brow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">be provoked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimi feriam sidera vertice,</quote> <trans><tr>hit</tr>, <tr>touch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. 2.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugno ferire vel calce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursare capro, cornu ferit ille, caveto,</quote> <trans><tr>pushes</tr>, <tr>butts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17953.3" n="2" level="3"> Of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">principio omnibus a rebus, quascumque videmus, Perpetuo fluere ac mitti spargique necesse est Corpora, quae feriant oculos visumque lacessant,</quote> <trans><tr>strike</tr>, <tr>touch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:923" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 923</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos (corpora, simulacra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:257" default="NO" valid="yes">257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum acies (res),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 691</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speciem colore (res),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 243</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his spectris etiam si oculi possent feriri, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriuntque summos fulmina montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec semper feriet, quodcumque minabitur, arous,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 350</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si fractus illabatur orbis, Impavidum ferient ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec levius tabulae laterum feriuntur ab undis, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: ferientia terram corpora, <hi rend="ital">smiting</hi> (in falling), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 786</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole fere radiis foriente cacumina primis,</quote> <trans><tr>hitting</tr>, <tr>touching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla imos ferit alba pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>touches</tr>, <tr>reaches to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:385" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferit aethera clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriat dum maesta remotas Fama procul terras,</quote> <trans><tr>extends to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 774</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17953.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17953.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To kill by striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give a deathblow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to slay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kill</hi>: hostem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 22, 51</bibl> (Ann. v. 284 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:60:4" default="NO" valid="yes">60, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 85, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem securi feriri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be beheaded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem telo trabali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retiarium (mirmillo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te (maritum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonem atque alias feras primus aut in primis ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 715</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17953.6" n="b" level="4"> Of the animals for sacrifice, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slaughter;</hi> and hence, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos humilem feriemus agnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccam Proserpinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 251</bibl></cit>; cf. the form of oath in making a compact (when a swine was sacrificed): SI PRIOR DEFEXIT <pb n="737" /> <cb n="FERI" /> (populus Romanus) PVBLICO CONSILIO DOLO MALO, TV ILLO DIE IVPPITER, POPVLVM ROMANVM SIC FERITO, VT EGO HVNC PORCVM HIC HODIE FERIAM: <cit><quote lang="la">TANTOQVE MAGIS FERITO, QVANTO MAGIS POTES POLLESQVE,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid aut sponsoribus in foedere opus esset aut obsidibus, ubi precatione res transigitur? per quem populum fiat, quo minus legibus dictis stetur, ut eum ita Juppiter feriat, quemadmodum a Fetialibus porcus feriatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>. (Cf. also: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis ante aram Stabant et caesā jungebant foedera porcă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 641</bibl></cit>).— Hence, </sense><sense id="n17953.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, foedus ferire, <hi rend="ital">to make a compact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covenant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">treaty</hi> (in Hebrew in precisely the same manner, <foreign />): accipe daque fidem, foedusque feri bene firmum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 33 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">is, quicum foedus feriri in Capitolio viderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videret ut satis honestum foedus feriretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:30:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorum turpissimorum foedera ferire,</quote> <trans><tr>to form illicit connections</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarchon jungit opes foedusque ferit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:154 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 154 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17953.8" n="3" level="3"> Of money, <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asses sextantario pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 44</bibl></cit>. Thus the designation of a triumvir monetalis is III. VIR. A. A. A. F. F., i. e. Triumvir auro argento aeri flando feriundo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 569</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n17953.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17953.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae faciliora sunt philosophis, quo minus multa patent in eorum vita, quae fortuna feriat,</quote> <trans><tr>reaches</tr>, <tr>affects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidit, ut ictu simili (i. e. morte propinqui) ferirer,</quote> <trans><tr>was struck with a similar blow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: verba palato,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring out</tr>, <tr>utter</tr>, <tr>speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 274</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonat vox, ut feritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriunt animum (sententiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnis sensus in fine sermonis feriat aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">binis aut ternis ferire verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:67:226" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 67, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtur Chrysippus medium ferire voluisse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to avoid extremes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17953.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to cozen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi> (mostly in vulg. lang.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ubi illa pendentem ferit, jam amplius orat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ferit astutos comica moecha Getas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">austeros arte ferire viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 50.—</sense><sense id="n17953.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To punish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict punishment</hi>: aliquem condemnatione centum librarum auri, Cod. 11, 11, 1.</sense></entryFree>
ferior: <entryFree id="n17954" type="main" key="fe_ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fērĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n17954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [feriac], <hi rend="ital">to rest from work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep holiday</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> ante- and post-class. and very rare for ferias habere, agere; but class. in the <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles ab armis feriabatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuerunt feriati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">male feriatos Troas,</quote> <trans><tr>keeping festival at an unseasonable time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus feriaturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sabatho etiam a bonis operibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, § 39</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fē-rĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">keeping holiday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unoccupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at leisure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17954.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deum sic feriatum volumus cessatione torpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriatus ne sis,</quote> <trans><tr>be not idle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntate sua feriati a negotiis publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 58</bibl></cit>: feriatus ab iis studiis, in quae, etc., Trebon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditatio argutiarum, in qua id genus homines consenescunt male feriati quos philosophos vulgus esse putat,</quote> <trans><tr>with leisure ill employed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:22:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga feriata,</quote> <trans><tr>long disused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17954.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">machaera feriata,</quote> <trans><tr>unemployed</tr>, <tr>idle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: freta, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 6, 156: <cit><quote lang="la">dies feriatus,</quote> <trans><tr>a holiday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6" default="NO">6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
feritans: <entryFree id="n17955" type="hapax" key="fe^ri^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrĭtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [‡ ferito, fero], <sense id="n17955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmeta caryotas feritantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 56</bibl></cit> dub. (al. ferentia).</sense></entryFree>
feritas: <entryFree id="n17956" type="main" key="fe^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ferus</etym>, <sense id="n17956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17956.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of beasts or men (rare but class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">ista in figura hominis feritas et immanitas beluae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo animi, remota a communitate conjunctioneque humana feritas est quaedam et immanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl>: qui primi dissipatos unum <cb n="FERO" /> in locum congregarunt eosque ex feritate illa ad justitiam atque mansuetudinem transduxerunt, <hi rend="ital">from the savage state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:281" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 281</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum civitas . . . cultu et feritate non multum a Germanis differebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:25" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 4</bibl>: neque ipse manus feritate dedisset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:568 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 568 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n17956.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things (perh. only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Scythici loci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 2, 2, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inamoena viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:33" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitigata arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:37" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia musti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferme: <entryFree id="n17957" type="main" key="ferme_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, fuller form of <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrē</orth>, q. v.</entryFree>
fermentarius: <entryFree id="n17958" type="main" key="fermenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fermentum</etym>, <sense id="n17958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to fermentation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>leavened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 15</bibl></cit> (al. fermentacius, for the more usual fermentatus panis, v. fermento).</sense></entryFree>
fermentatio: <entryFree id="n17959" type="main" key="fermenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. for ferrumentatio; cf. ferruminatio</etym>, <sense id="n17959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a union</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniting</hi>: naturarum, Liberat. Breviar. Caus. Nestor. 8.</sense></entryFree>
fermentatus: <entryFree id="n17960" type="main" key="fermenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fermento.</entryFree>
fermentesco: <entryFree id="n17961" type="main" key="fermentesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermentesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n17961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [fermentum] (lit., to ferment, to rise in fermenting; transf., of the earth), <hi rend="ital">to swell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become loose</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">tellus quoque illo modo (i. e. ab nive diutius sedente) fermentescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 28, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fermento: <entryFree id="n17962" type="main" key="fermento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to rise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ferment;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17962.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis hordeaceus ervi aut cicerculae farina fermentabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: fermentato pane ali, <hi rend="ital">with fermented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leavened</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">light bread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fermentatus panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> and 29: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus sinitur fermentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 13, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17962.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to swell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loosen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:13" default="NO">11, 3, 13</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n17962.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 10, 263</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fermentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n17962.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si deprimatur scobis in regesto, quod est fermentatum plus dipondio semisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(optimi canes) debent esse pedibus magnis ... solo fermentato ac molli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17962.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">corrupted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 354</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fermentum: <entryFree id="n17963" type="main" key="fermentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fermentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. for fervimentum, from fervo, ferveo</etym>, <sense id="n17963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which causes fermentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yeast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17963.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:68" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 12, § 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis sine fermento,</quote> <trans><tr>unleavened bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes">30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17963.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17963.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which loosens the soil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17963.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A drink made of fermented barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malt liquor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 380</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17963.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(uxor) nunc in fermento tota est, ita turget mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 3, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of the <hi rend="ital">cause of anger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe et istud Fermentum tibi habe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fero: <entryFree id="n17964" type="main" key="fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype> (ante-class. redupl. form in the <sense id="n17964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 68</bibl>: tetulisti, Att. and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 17 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:section=672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, § 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetulissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetulero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 101</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>a wide-spread root; Sanscr. bhar-, carry, bharas, burden; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fe/rw</foreign>; Goth. bar, bairo, bear, produce, whence barn, child; Anglo-Saxon beran, whence Engl. bear, birth; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 300" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 300</bibl>; Fick, Vergl. Wört. p. 135. The <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> forms, tuli, etc., from the root tul-, tol-; Sanscr. tol-jami, lift, weigh; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tlh=nai</foreign>, endure, cf. <foreign lang="greek">ta/las, ta/lanton</foreign>; Lat. tollo, tolerare, (t)latus, etc. Cf. Goth. thulan, Germ. dulden, Geduld; Anglo-Sax. tholian, suffer. <hi rend="ital">Supine</hi> lātum, i. e. tlatum; cf. supra; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 220" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 220</bibl>; Corss. Ausspr. 2, 73</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring.</hi> (For syn. cf.: gero, porto, bajulo, veho; effero, infero; tolero, patior, sino, permitto, etc.) </sense><sense id="n17964.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17964.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri proprie dicimus, quae quis suo corpore bajulat, portari ea, quae quis in jumento secum ducit, agi ea, quae animalia sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:235" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 235</bibl></cit>: oneris quidvis feret, <cb n="FERO" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin te in fundo conspicer fodere aut arare aut aliquid ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus eorum, qui arma ferre possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma et vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver nudis humeris (heres),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 142</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">symbolum filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olera et pisciculos minutos ferre obolo in cenam seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vina et unguenta et flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discerpta ferentes Memora gruis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">talos, nucesque sinu laxo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolium faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste opertā lecticā latus per oppidum est ut mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticā in Capitolium latus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa judices latus (puer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se ferens (in essedo) Darium puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natum ad Stygios iterum fero mergere fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:134" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 134</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre aliquem in oculis, or simply oculis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hold dear</tr>, <tr>love exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Fam. 16:27:2" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 27, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17964.4" n="1" level="3"> With the idea of motion predominating, <hi rend="ital">to set in motion</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">to move onward quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drive away;</hi> with se or mid. (so esp. freq.), <hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betake one's self;</hi> and of things, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17964.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi in rapidas amnis dispeximus undas: Stantis equi corpus transvorsum ferre videtur Vis, et in advorsum flumen contrudere raptim: Et, quocumque oculos trajecimus, omnia ferri Et fluere assimili nobis ratione videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:422 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 422 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cernimus alta Exhalare vapore altaria, ferreque fumum,</quote> <trans><tr>to send up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 432</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis ut vomat ignes, Ad caelumque ferat flammaï fulgura rursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 725</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo supinas si tuleris manus,</quote> <trans><tr>raisest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te rursus in bellum resorbens Unda fretis tulit aestuosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ire, pedes quocumque ferent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 21</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">me per Aegaeos tumultus Aura feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to put the standards in motion</tr>, <tr>to break up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol, si id scissem, numquam huc tetulissem pedem,</quote> <trans><tr>have stirred foot</tr>, <tr>have come</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 756</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:112" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum,</quote> <trans><tr>to walk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 681</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agiles gressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:180" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagos gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:101" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagos cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 243</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ventus ferebat,</quote> <trans><tr>bore</tr>, <tr>drove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim, si feret flatus, danda sunt vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera duo, quae extra murum ad portum ferebant,</quote> <trans><tr>led</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergit ad speluncam, si forte eo vestigia ferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvam ligna ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry coals to Newcastle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or mid., <hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsa paene insula mihi sese obviam ferre vellet,</quote> <trans><tr>to meet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non dubitaverim me gravissimis tempestatibus obvium ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ferro accingor rursus ... meque extra tecta ferebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 672</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 779</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grassatorum plurimi palam se ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>.—Of things as subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi forte ita se tetulerunt semina aquarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have collected themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 672</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum omni celeritate et studio incitatus ferebatur,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 78, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii aliam in partem perterriti ferebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>betook themselves</tr>, <tr>fled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fera) supra venabula fertur,</quote> <trans><tr>rushes</tr>, <tr>springs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc juvenis nota fertur regione viarum,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densos fertur moribundus in hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>rushes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque feremur, danda vela sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non alto semper feremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, utrum Nave ferar magna an parva, ferar unus et idem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tenui ferar Penna biformis per liquidum aethera Vates,</quote> <trans><tr>fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">(corpuscula rerum) ubi tam volucri levitate ferantur,</quote> <trans><tr>move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 195</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum mobiliter summa levitate feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 745</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus neque movetur et infima est, et in eam feruntur omnia nutu suo pondera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus longo spatio per fines Nantuatium, etc. ... citatus fertur,</quote> <trans><tr>flows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Hirt. B. <pb n="738" /> <cb n="FERO" /> G. 8, 40, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (flamma) ad caelum usque ferretur,</quote> <trans><tr>ascended</tr>, <tr>arose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Rarely ferre = se ferre: quem procul conspiciens ad se ferentem pertimescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n17964.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away by force</hi>, as a robber, etc.: <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii rapiunt incensa feruntque Pergama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam te (i. e. exstinctum Daphnin) fata tulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>snatched away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 34</bibl></cit>. So esp. in the phrase ferre et agere, of taking booty, plundering, where ferre applies to portable things, and agere to men and cattle; v. ago.—</sense><sense id="n17964.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima tum tellus etiam majora ferebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:942 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 942 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae autem terra fruges ferre, et, ut mater, cibos suppeditare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (florem) ferunt terrae solutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus jugera fruges et Cererem ferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus iste feret piper et thus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(olea) fructum ramis pluribus feret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferundo arbor peribit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.9" n="4" level="3"> Of a woman or sheanimal, <hi rend="ital">to bear offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be pregnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorans nurum ventrem ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of animals: equa ventrem fert duodecim menses, vacca decem, ovis et capra quinque, sus quatuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi octonis mensibus ferunt partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te conceptam saeva leaena tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:90" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 90</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tulerat mater claro Phoenissa Laconi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had borne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:666" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 666</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.10" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi> as an oblation: <cit><quote lang="la">liba et Mopsopio dulcia melle feram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">liba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lancesque et liba Baccho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura superis, altaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 577</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.11" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, as gain, a reward, a possession, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod posces, feres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 106</bibl></cit>; cf.: quodvis donum et praemium a me optato; <cit><quote lang="la">id optatum feres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus ex sese (i. e. re publica) magna acerbitate permixtos tulissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille crucem pretium sceleris tulit, hic diadema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coram rege sua de paupertate tacentes Plus poscente ferent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17964.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17964.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis haec tellus morbi caelumque mali fert,</quote> <trans><tr>bears</tr>, <tr>contains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 663</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">veterrima quaeque, ut ea vina, quae vetustatem ferunt, esse debent suavissima,</quote> <trans><tr>which carry age</tr>, <tr>are old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta vetustatem si modo nostra ferent,</quote> <trans><tr>will have</tr>, <tr>will attain to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bear</tr>, <tr>have</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insani sapiens nomen ferat, aequus iniqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille finis Appio alienae personae ferendae fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>of bearing an assumed character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archimimus personam ejus ferens,</quote> <trans><tr>personating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: (Garyophyllon) fert et in spinis piperis similitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 7, 15, § 30</bibl></cit>: fer mi auxilium, <hi rend="ital">bring assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">help</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 50 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui opem auxiliumque ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 21</bibl> et saep.: opem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 86 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">opem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 3</bibl> (with succurrere saluti); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl> (with salutem); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to proffer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coriolanus ab sede sua cum ferret matri obviae complexum,</quote> <trans><tr>offered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua fidem tanto est operi latura vetustas,</quote> <trans><tr>will bring</tr>, <tr>procure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vox audita laborum Prima tulit finem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 118</bibl></cit>: suspicionem falsam, <hi rend="ital">to entertain suspicion</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 5</bibl> (Trag. v. 348 ed. Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n17964.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n17964.15" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tulit ad scenam ventoso gloria curru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 177</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi quaedam ingenita natura ... recta nos ad ea, quae conveniunt causae, ferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi illud, quod eo, quo intendas, ferat deducatque, cognoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstincti ad caelum gloria fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudibus aliquem in caelum ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to extol</tr>, <tr>praise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <cb n="FERO" /> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Otho, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam pugnam miris laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe rem dicendo subiciet oculis: saepe supra feret quam fieri possit,</quote> <trans><tr>wilt exalt</tr>, <tr>magnify</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferte sermonibus et multiplicate fama bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre in majus vero incertas res fama solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitate et scelere ferri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be impelled</tr>, <tr>carried away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 70, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceps amentia ferebare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri avaritiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator suo jam impetu fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: eloquentia, quae cursu magno sonituque ferretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 97</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(eloquentia) feratur non semitis sed campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio, quae ferri debet ac fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 112</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (historia) currere debet ac ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; so often: animus fert (aliquem aliquo), <hi rend="ital">the mind moves one to any thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cujusque animus fert, eo discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites procurrentes consistentesque, quo loco ipsorum tulisset animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">qua quemque animus fert, effugite superbiam regiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si maxime animus ferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 775</bibl>.—With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, the mind moves one to do any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Otho, 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: mens tulit nos ferro exscindere Thebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:753" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 753</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.16" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fert aetas, animum quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam te fata tulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invida Domitium fata tulere sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 4, 123, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">like efferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry forth to burial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:89" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.17" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aetas prima Athenis oratorem prope perfectum tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas parentum, pejor avis, tulit Nos nequiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curium tulit et Camillum Saeva paupertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.18" n="4" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 6.) <hi rend="ital">To bear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cotta et Sulpicius omnium judicio facile primas tulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:183" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 49, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmam,</quote> <trans><tr>to carry off</tr>, <tr>win</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam ex inermi,</quote> <trans><tr>to gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 51, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam et gloriam annonae levatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam laudem inter suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriam, tribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to get their votes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 20, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 13</bibl></cit> (diff. from 8. a.): <cit><quote lang="la">responsum ab aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to receive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsam a populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repulsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 19 al.</bibl>: calumniam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be convicted of a false accusation</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut filius partem dimidiam hereditatis ferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas portiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; 61.—</sense><sense id="n17964.19" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> any thing unpleasant; or pregn., <hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17964.20" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi> in any manner. </sense><sense id="n17964.21" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: servi injurias nimias aegre ferunt, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(onus senectutis) modice ac sapienter sicut omnia ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre ferre repulsam consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc moderatiore animo ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid toleranter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo magis ferre animo aequo videmur, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:48:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu fortunam, sic nos te, Celse, feremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.22" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quis aegre ferat, se pauperem esse,</quote> <trans><tr>take it ill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 27, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ereptum esse, graviter et acerbe ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo ferant veterani, exercitum Brutum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n17964.23" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Lentulo scilicet sic fero, ut debeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo Caesar ferret de auctoritate perscripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid moleste fers de illo, qui? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.24" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliter acciderit, humaniter feremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi imposuisset aliquid, animo iniquo tulissem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.25" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put up with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17964.26" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: quis hanc contumeliam, quis hoc imperium, quis hanc servitutem ferre potest? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui potentissimorum hominum contumaciam numquam tulerim, ferrem hujus asseclae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus desiderium civitas ferre diutius non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitandi non ferebat laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 77, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum impetum nostrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum atque aciem oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="FERO" /> 39, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortatio gravior quam aures Sulpicii ferre didicissent,</quote> <trans><tr>to hear unmoved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa tulit fecitque puer, sudavit et alsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatoris fastidia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisse (Epaminondam) patientem suorumque injurias ferentem civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7</bibl></cit>.—Of personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ferret, si parentem non ferret suum?</quote> <trans><tr>brook</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimates quis ferat, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ut jam nos ferat quisquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an laturi sint Romani talem regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim ferat puerum aut adolescentulum, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.27" n="(b)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt aures hominum, illa ... laudari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non feret assiduas potiori te dare noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 628</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quidem in hoc opere praecipi quis ferat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:69" default="NO">11, 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servo nubere nympha tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alios vinci potuisse ferendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 555</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17964.28" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod rapta, feremus, dummodo reddat eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud non ferendum, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17964.29" n="6" level="3"> With the access, notion of publicity, <hi rend="ital">to make public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ipsum dolorem hic tulit paulo apertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam apertissime tulimus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id obscure ferebat nec dissimulare ullo modo poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud clam tulit iram adversus praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 47, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tacite ejus verecundiam non tulit senatus, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.30" n="b" level="4"> Prae se ferre, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let be seen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rei tantae facultatem consecutum esse me, non profiteor: secutum me esse, prae me fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli, quaeso, prae te ferre, vos plane expertes esse doctrinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocres terrores ... prae se fert et ostentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc virtutem prae se ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalium disciplinarum prae se scientiam tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum animum (verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">(comae) turbatae prae se ferre aliquid affectus videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio prae se fert felicissimam facilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.31" n="7" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to report</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnibus ferebat sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii alia sermonibus ferebant Romanos facturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferte sermonibus et multiplicate fama bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres ita fama ferebant, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 31, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hascine propter res maledicas famas ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama eadem tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aliud per illos dies populus credulitate, prudentes diversa fama, tulere,</quote> <trans><tr>talk about</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimici famam non ita, ut nata est, ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fers, cedo,</quote> <trans><tr>tell</tr>, <tr>say</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra (laus) semper feretur et praedicabitur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse ... acturum se id per populum aperte ferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 40, 2</bibl></cit>;
