<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">1: saepe homines morbos magis esse timendos ferunt quam Tartara leti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prognen ita velle ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 470</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 527</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi territos se ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 26</bibl> (32); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi fama tulit fessum te caede procubuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarii ad senatum missi ferebant, Macronem praesedisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 47</bibl></cit> (53).—</sense><sense id="n17964.32" n="b" level="4"> Ferunt, fertur, feruntur, etc., <hi rend="ital">they relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say; it is said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it appears</hi>, etc.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam Xenocratem ferunt, cum quaereretur ex eo, etc... respondisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisse quendam ferunt Demaratum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ex Hyperboreis Delphos ferunt advenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo omnium in dicendo, ut ferebant, accrrimus et copiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres fertur fruges ... mortalibus instituisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Syria quoque fertur item locus esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is Amulium regem interemisse fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in contione dixisse fertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (urbem) Juno fertur terris omnibus unam coluisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sat idoneus Pugnae ferebaris,</quote> <trans><tr>you were accounted</tr>, <tr>held</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ornate locutus est, sicut fertur et mihi videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: cum quaestor ex Macedonia venissem Athenas florente<pb n="739" /> <cb n="FERO" />  Academia, ut temporibus illis ferebatur, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 45.—</sense><sense id="n17964.33" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To give out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass off</hi> a person or thing by any name or for any thing; and, in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass for</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to pass current</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (Mercurium) omnium inventorem artium ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Servium conditorem posteri famā ferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 42, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se Philippum regiaeque stirpis ferebat, cum esset ultimae,</quote> <trans><tr>set himself up for</tr>, <tr>boast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avum M. Antonium, avunculum Augustum ferens,</quote> <trans><tr>boasting of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ingenuum se et Lachetem mutato nomine coeperat ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante Periclem, cujus scripta quaedam feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 27</bibl></cit> (quoted paraphrastically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 12</bibl>): sub nomine meo libri ferebantur artis rhetoricae, Quint. prooem. 7; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, quae sub nomine meo feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ejus (Catonis) vel provisa prudenter vel acta constanter vel responsa acute ferebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua ex re in pueritia nobilis inter aequales ferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.34" n="8" level="3"> Polit. and jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n17964.35" n="a" level="4"> Suffragium or sententiam, <hi rend="ital">to give in one's vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to vote</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt suffragia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo foedere populus Romanus sententiam non tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo vos (judices) sententiam per tabellam feretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 104</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the voting of judges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of senators: parcite, ut sit qui in senatu de bello et pace sententiam ferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31, § 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.36" n="b" level="4"> Legem (privilegium, rogationem) ad populum, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">move a proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose a law</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciose Philippus in tribunatu, cum legem agrariam ferret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae lex paucis his annis lata esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Corn. 1, 3</bibl></cit> (vol. xi. p. 10 B. and K.): <cit><quote lang="la">familiarissimus tuus de te privilegium tulit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sullam illam rogationem de se nolle ferri (shortly before: Lex ferri coepta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem de aliquo, contra or in aliquem, ad populum, ad plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 25, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, te ipsum ad populum tulisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>proposed a bill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut P. Scaevola tribunus plebis ferret ad plebem, vellentne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 25, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Sulla ipse ita tulit de civitate, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 35, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de judicio ferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum, ut absentis ratio haberetur, ferebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato ut solet ad populum, ut equum escendere liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n17964.37" n="c" level="4"> Judicem, said of the plaintiff, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">propose to the defendant as judge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego si ferrem judicem, refugere non deberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl>.—Hence, judicem alicui, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to propose a judge to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bring a suit against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sue</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">se iterum ac saepius judicem illi ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 33, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17964.38" n="9" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Mercant. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note down</hi> a sum in a book: <cit><quote lang="la">quod minus Dolabella Verri acceptum rettulit, quam Verres illi expensum tulerit, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has set down as paid</tr>, <tr>has paid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=100 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 100 sq.</bibl></cit>, v. expendo.—</sense><sense id="n17964.39" n="10" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of abstr. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to require</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">render necessary; to allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sui periculi rationes ferre ac postulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravioribus verbis uti, quam natura fert,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 57</bibl></cit>: quid ferat Fors, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. 203 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quamdiu voluntas Apronii tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aetas illa fert,</quote> <trans><tr>as is usual at that time of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me, ut tempora nostra, non ut amor tuus fert, vere perscribe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ita existimabam tempora rei publicae ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita commodum vestrum fert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proüt Thermitani hominis facultates ferebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vestra voluntas feret,</quote> <trans><tr>if such be your pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 24, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut opinio et spes et conjectura nostra fert,</quote> <trans><tr>according to our opinion</tr>, <tr>hope</tr>, <tr>and belief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mea fert opinio,</quote> <trans><tr>according to my opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: si occasio tulerit, <hi rend="ital">if occasion require</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tempus ad eam rem tulit, sivi, animum ut expleret suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: in hac ratione quid res, quid causa, <cb n="FERO" /> quid tempus ferat, tu perspicies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura fert, ut extrema ex altera parte graviter, ex altera autem acute sonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociam se cujuscumque fortunae, et, si ita ferret, comitem exitii promittebat (sc. res or fortuna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si ita ferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferocia: <entryFree id="n17965" type="main" key="fe^ro_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrōcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ferox</etym>, <sense id="n17965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">untamed spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, in a good or bad sense (class.). </sense><sense id="n17965.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infirmitas puerorum et ferocitas juvenum et gravitas jam constantis aetatis et senectutis maturitas naturale quiddam habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana virtus et ferocia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferociam animi in vultu retinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ardoris ac ferociae miles habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus tamen ferociae Britanni praeferunt, ut quos nondum longa pax emollierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus ac ferocia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor ac ferocia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferociā verborum militem incendebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17965.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17965.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: ferocitate atque ferocia, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 19</bibl>: qui comperit ejus vim et effrenatam illam ferociam, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 492, 3</bibl> (Rep. 5, 8 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">arrogans atque intoleranda ferocia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per communes liberos oravit exueret ferociam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:115:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 115, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolida mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17965.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of wine, <hi rend="ital">harshness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferocio: <entryFree id="n17966" type="main" key="fe^ro_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrōcĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unruly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ungovernable; to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be furious</hi>: Ferocio, <foreign lang="greek">a)griai/nomai</foreign>, Gloss. Labb. (perh. only ante- and post - class.; for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl>, ferocientes equos is, acc. to the MSS., to be read efferentis se equos): ferocit apud Catonem ferociter agit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92, 7</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">si permulcti sonis mitioribus non immodice ferocirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio ferociens saeviensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">15: in aliquam sectam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferociens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferocitas: <entryFree id="n17967" type="main" key="fe^ro_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrōcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n17967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">untamed courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, in a good or bad sense; cf. ferocia (class.). </sense><sense id="n17967.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis viribus et animi ferocitate ceteris praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi ferocitate exsultantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17967.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">fierceness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferocity</hi>: ferocitate atque ferocia, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae haec, malum, ferocia est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ferocitatem tuam istam comprimerem et audaciam frangerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocitatem reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax apud Achillem querens de ferocitate Trojanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia contumacia et ferocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 15, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferociter: <entryFree id="n17968" type="main" key="fe^ro_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrōcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n17968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">courageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>, etc., v. ferox <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
feroculus: <entryFree id="n17969" type="main" key="fe^ro_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrōcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n17969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [ferox], <hi rend="ital">somewhat spirited</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi> (very rare): eja, quam ferocula'st! Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 75, 30</bibl>: quid tu, miles tiro, tam feroculus es, Auct. B. Afr. 16, 1.</sense></entryFree>
feronia: <entryFree id="n17970" type="main" key="Fe_ro_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fērōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a Sabine word; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 74</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n17970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old Italian deity related to Tellus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the patroness of freedmen: several groves were dedicated to her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the festivals of the goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great markets were held; in later times identified with</hi> Juno, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 800</bibl> Serv.; 8, 564; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1313 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1756</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 24</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Fabrett. p. 451.</sense></entryFree>
ferox: <entryFree id="n17971" type="main" key="fe^rox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrox</orth>, <itype>ōcis</itype> (<sense id="n17971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> ferocum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:275" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 275</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> feroci, Neue, Formenl. 2, 67 sq.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qh/r</foreign>, Aeol. <foreign lang="greek">fh/r, qhri/on</foreign>; cf.: ferus, fera; cf. also Zend. dvar, to run, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qrw/skw, qorei=n</foreign>, Lat. furere</etym>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gallant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">headstrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untamable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi> (class.; syn.: dirus, ferus, durus, saevus, crudelis; immanis, immitis, barbarus, etc.). </sense><sense id="n17971.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">moechus qui formest ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā ferox, vehemens, manu promptus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium es vehemens feroxque naturā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicimus vi feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: Aequorum magna gens <cb n="FERR" /> et ferox, <hi rend="ital">warlike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sygambri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: virgo (i. e. <hi rend="ital">Minerva</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:179" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 179</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:457" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 457</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca amoena, voluptaria facile in otio feroces militum animos molliverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 106, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">feroces ad bellandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus pericula ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Triaria ultra feminam ferox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir nobilis ac ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus ferocissimorum juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo adversante, cum ferocissimi cecidissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n17971.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">equi indomiti, feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgentia ferocem fortasse atque arrogantem et infestum facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dote fretae, feroces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>arrogant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 305, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae secundis rebus feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robore corporis stolide ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequicquam Veneris praesidio ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit Medea ferox invictaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus ferox inopiā rei familiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus aetas animusque ferox erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patribus ferox,</quote> <trans><tr>haughty toward the senators</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellis civilibus, victoria, etiamsi ad meliores venit, tamen eos ipsos ferociores impotentioresque reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 305, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quia tecum eram, propterea animo eram ferocior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas ferocissimas affectiones amoris atque odii coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17971.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae feroces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox scelerum,</quote> <trans><tr>eager for</tr>, <tr>prone to crimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum Spretor erat mentisque ferox Ixione natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17971.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox in suos erat miles, ignavus in hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17971.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferox est, viginti minas meas tractare sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium renovare ferox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:8" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrōcĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n17971.6" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Courageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strenue et ferociter facta in bello plura memorari possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adequitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci ferocius decernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quo ferocissime pro Romana societate adversus Punicum foedus steterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17971.7" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Fiercely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savagely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere et ferociter et libere dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictae sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ferocius (exagitatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
ferramentarius: <entryFree id="n17972" type="main" key="ferra_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ferramentum</etym>, <sense id="n17972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of iron implements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blacksmith</hi> (late Lat.): aerarii, ferramentarii, statuarii, Firm. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ferramentum: <entryFree id="n17973" type="main" key="ferra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ferrum</etym>, <sense id="n17973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tool of iron</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pointed</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">with iron</hi>, esp. agricultural implements (a hatchet, axe, sickle, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">puteum periclo et ferramentis fodimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ferramentorum varietate scribit (Cato) permulta ... ut falces, palas, rastros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:6" default="NO">3, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:21" default="NO">4, 24, 21</bibl>; 4, 29, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: peditem super arma ferramentis quoque et copiis onerare, <hi rend="ital">axes</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl>: bonorum ferramentorum studiosus, <hi rend="ital">swords</hi> or <hi rend="ital">daggers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 19, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 86</bibl>: nulla ferramentorum copia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 42, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsoria,</quote> <trans><tr>razors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:36" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnantium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>swords</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumento medici legato ... ferramenta legato cedunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferraria: <entryFree id="n17974" type="main" key="ferra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. ferrarius.</entryFree>
ferrariarius: <entryFree id="n17975" type="gloss" key="ferra_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ferraria; v. ferrarius, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n17975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who works in iron-mines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a miner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ferrarius: <entryFree id="n17976" type="main" key="ferra_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferrum</etym>, <sense id="n17976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupied with iron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17976.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fabri,</quote> <trans><tr>blacksmiths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIATOR,</quote> <trans><tr>an iron-monger</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 640, 2</bibl></cit> and 4: metalla, <hi rend="ital">iron-mines</hi>, <pb n="740" /> <cb n="FERR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 15, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officina,</quote> <trans><tr>a smith's shop</tr>, <tr>smithy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>for quenching the red-hot iron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 63, § 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 13, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17976.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n17976.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a blacksmith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a smith</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; Firm. Math. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4066</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n17976.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n17976.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An iron-mine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iron-works</hi>: sunt in his regionibus ferrariae, argenti fodinae pulcherrimae, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1239</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17976.6" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. herba.) <hi rend="ital">The plant vervain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 65</bibl> and 72.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n17977" type="main" key="ferra_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. ferrarius, II. A.</entryFree>
ferratilis: <entryFree id="n17978" type="hapax" key="ferra_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferratus</etym>, <sense id="n17978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with iron;</hi> comically said of slaves who are <hi rend="ital">ironed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fettered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 18</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
ferratus: <entryFree id="n17979" type="main" key="ferra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferrum</etym>, <sense id="n17979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shod with iron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17979.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: postes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 622</bibl> (Ann. v. 271 ed. Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 551</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 361</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calx,</quote> <trans><tr>armed with a spur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 714</bibl></cit>: servi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fettered</hi> (sc. catenis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 11</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the preced. art.: agmina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>iron-clad</tr>, <tr>in armor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>ferruginous</tr>, <tr>chalybeate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma suum,</quote> <trans><tr>iron</tr>, <tr>made of iron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:90" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17979.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. milites): <cit><quote lang="la">in fronte statuerat ferratos, in cornibus cohortes,</quote> <trans><tr>harnessed soldiers</tr>, <tr>cuirassiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferrea: <entryFree id="n17980" type="main" key="ferrea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. ferreus, I.</entryFree>
ferreus: <entryFree id="n17981" type="main" key="ferre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferrum</etym>, <sense id="n17981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">iron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17981.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni utuntur aut aere aut taleis ferreis ... pro nummo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; for which <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 58, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clathri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae imagunculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules,</quote> <trans><tr>an iron statue of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 40, § 141</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: hastati spargunt hastas, fit ferreus imber, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 287 ed. Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">imitated: imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 284</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seges telorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>glistening with weapons</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 601</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17981.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to iron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans><tr>iron-color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrica,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of working iron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17981.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17981.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfeeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard-hearted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui virtutem duram et quasi ferream esse quandam volunt (opp. tenera atque tractabilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam fuit durus et ferreus, quis tam inhumanus, qui? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreus essem, si te non amarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus et ferreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus et vere ferreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam esset ferreus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o te ferreum, qui illius periculis non moveris!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (carmina) tamen numquam ferrea dixit Amo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:2" default="NO">3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors vitae (with difficilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os ferreum,</quote> <trans><tr>shameless</tr>, <tr>impudent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: ferrea tum vero proles exorta repente est, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the iron age</hi>, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 63, 159; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17981.5" n="B" level="2"> With the idea of firmness, fixedness predominating, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) in parsimonia, in patientia laboris periculique, ferrei prope corporis animique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 626</bibl>; cf.: scriptor (Atilius), Licin. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 501</bibl></cit>: olli dura quies oculos et ferreus urget Somnus, <hi rend="ital">ironsleep</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">death</hi> (a transl. of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">xa/lkeos u(/pnos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 745</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 309</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta Sororum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 781</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferricrepinus: <entryFree id="n17982" type="hapax" key="ferri^cre^pi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrĭcrĕpĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferrum + crepo</etym>, <sense id="n17982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">resounding with the clanking of irons</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fetters;</hi> comically formed: <cit><quote lang="la">apud fustitudinas ferricrepinas insulas, i. e. ergastula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferrifodina: <entryFree id="n17983" type="main" key="ferri^fo^di_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrĭfŏdīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ferrum + fodina</etym>, <sense id="n17983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an iron-mine</hi>, not in use, mentioned by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:33:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 33, § 62</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ferriterium: <entryFree id="n17984" type="hapax" key="ferri^te^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrĭtĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ferrum + tero</etym>, <cb n="FERR" /> <sense id="n17984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place of those who are galled with irons;</hi> a comically formed word for ergastulum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ferriterus: <entryFree id="n17985" type="main" key="Ferri^te^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ferrĭtĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ferrum + tero</etym>, <sense id="n17985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comic name given to a slave who is galled with fetters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ferritribax: <entryFree id="n17986" type="hapax" key="ferri^tri_bax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrĭtrībax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibrida, from ferrum + <foreign lang="greek">tri/bw</foreign>, tero</etym>, <sense id="n17986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iron-galled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">galled with fetters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagipatidae, ferritribaces viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferruginans: <entryFree id="n17987" type="hapax" key="ferru_gi^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūgĭnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferrugo</etym>, <sense id="n17987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that tastes of iron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferrugineus: <entryFree id="n17988" type="main" key="ferru_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūgĭnĕus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūgĭnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 76</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n17988.0" n="I" level="1"> Of color, <hi rend="ital">of the color of iron-rust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark-red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferruginous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliolum habeas ferrugineum, nam is colos thalassicust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela lutea, russa, ferrugina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 303</bibl></cit> (= <foreign lang="greek">kuane/h</foreign>, for which: <cit><quote lang="la">caerulea puppis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 410</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">hyacinthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:600" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus (inferorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus Plutonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 275</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17988.1" n="II" level="1"> Of taste, <hi rend="ital">like iron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferruginous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor fontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 8, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferruginus: <entryFree id="n17989" type="main" key="ferru_gi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūgĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ferrugineus <sense id="n17989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ferrugo: <entryFree id="n17990" type="main" key="ferru_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ferrum; like aerugo from aes</etym>, <sense id="n17990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iron-rust</hi> (syn.: aerugo, rubigo). </sense><sense id="n17990.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 79, § 151</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17990.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the color of iron-rust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a darkred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark-chestnut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dusky color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuclei vestiti aliā ferruginis tunicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 35</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">sea-green</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridis ferrugine barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:960" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 960</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutit obscurā tinctas ferrugine habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:404" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 404</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 789: sol caput obscurā nitidum ferrugine texit,</quote> <trans><tr>gloom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maesta obtenta Ditis ferrugine regna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus manu ferrugine tincta Tangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictus acu chlamydem et ferrugine clarus Hiberā,</quote> <trans><tr>purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 582</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinā ferrugine clarus et ostro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violas ferrugine pingit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 93</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17990.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">envy</hi> (cf. aerugo): animusque mala ferrugine purus, Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 95.</sense></entryFree>
ferrum: <entryFree id="n17991" type="main" key="ferrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. dharti, firmness; Lat. firmus</etym>, <sense id="n17991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iron.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17991.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 39, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 571</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1241" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1286" default="NO" valid="yes">1286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 20</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum quod resipit ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>has a taste of iron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17991.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17991.3" n="1" level="3"> As a fig. of hard-heartedness, unfeelingness, cruelty, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere ferrum in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 614</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum et scopulos gestare in corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durior ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:712" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 712</bibl></cit>; hence for <hi rend="ital">the iron age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 127</bibl>; 15, 260; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17991.4" n="2" level="3"> As an image of firmness, endurance, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n17991.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, any thing made of iron, <hi rend="ital">an iron implement</hi>, as <hi rend="ital">a plough</hi>: glebas proscindere ferro, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 401, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1295</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro scindimus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a hatchet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro mitiget agrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 186</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">an axe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordaci velut icta ferro Pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 60</bibl> (for which, shortly before, bipennis); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 168</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a dart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petita ferro belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the tip of an arrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstabat ferrum de pectore aduncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 128</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the head</hi> (of a spear), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">an iron stylus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra tenet ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 522</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">hair-scissors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitus longos ferro resecare capillos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 182</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">curling-irons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines vibratos calido ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 100</bibl></cit> et saep.—Esp. freq. <hi rend="ital">a sword</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusum ferro. Metellum veneno sustulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem cum ferro invadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ferro aut fame interire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uri virgis ferroque necari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiator, ferrum recipere jussus,</quote> <trans><tr>the stroke of the sword</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>. So, ferrum et ignis, like our <hi rend="ital">fire and sword</hi>, to denote devastation, utter destruction: <cit><quote lang="la">huic urbi ferro ignique minitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 14, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium urbes agrique ferro atque igni vastentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem ferro, igni, quacumque vi possent, interrumpant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 59, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce ferunt Troës ferrumque ignemque Jovemque In Danaas classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque meos ferrum flammasque penates Impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:551" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 551</bibl></cit>; so, conversely,<cb n="FERT" />  igni ferroque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 21, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 21, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma ferroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:18:14" default="NO">3, 18, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 2, 2</bibl>: ferrum, i. q. <hi rend="ital">arms</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force of arms</hi>: ferro, non auro, vitam cernamus, utrique, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 202 ed. Vahl.); cf.: quem nemo ferro potuit superare nec auro, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 220 ed. Vahl.): adnuit, sese mecum decernere ferro, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 822</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 136 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">decernere ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 317</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 525</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 218</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere ferro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro regna lacessere,</quote> <trans><tr>with war</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 186</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque omnis, Latio quae servit purpura ferro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>made subject by the force of arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 228</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: ferrum meum in igni est, i. q. mea nunc res agitur, Sen. Mort. Claud.</sense></entryFree>
ferrumen: <entryFree id="n17992" type="main" key="ferru_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fērū-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ferrum</etym>. <sense id="n17992.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glue</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod furto calcis sine ferumine suo caementa componuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 27</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: esse videtur Homeri (versus) simplicior et sincerior, Vergilii autem <foreign lang="greek">vewterikw/teros</foreign> et quodam quasi ferumine immisso fucatior, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connecting word</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 26, 3</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n17992.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Iron-rust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(crystalla) infestantur plurimis vitiis, scabro ferumine, maculosa nube, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferruminatio: <entryFree id="n17993" type="main" key="ferru_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūmĭnātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fērū-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ferrumino</etym>, <sense id="n17993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cementing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soldering</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:23:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 23, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ferruumino: <entryFree id="n17994" type="main" key="ferru_umi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferrūumĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fērū-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ferrumen, I.</etym>, <sense id="n17994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17994.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita (bitumine) feruminatis Babylonis muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tuum scyphum alieno plumbo plumbaveris aut alieno argento feruminaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare (ossa) fracta non feruminantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 86, § 214</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navium commissuras,</quote> <trans><tr>to caulk the seams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n17994.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, comically: <cit><quote lang="la">labra in labris feruminat,</quote> <trans><tr>glues his lips</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 25</bibl></cit> (dub.; Lorenz, labra ab labellis fer mihi).</sense></entryFree>
fertilis: <entryFree id="n17995" type="main" key="ferti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fero, I. B. 3.</etym>. <sense id="n17995.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi> (class.; syn.: ferax, fecundus, uber). </sense><sense id="n17995.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n17995.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager, quamvis fertilis, sine cultura fructuosus esse non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asia tam opima est ac fertilis. ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri opimi et fertiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agri uberrimi maximeque fertiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri lati et fertiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:51:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N.
