D. 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager fertilis et praeda onustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:12:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 12, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliveta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus (i. e. vinum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:240" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu nutricis (i. e. Copiae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:127" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 127</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens, i. e. the Hydra,</quote> <trans><tr>continually producing new heads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 95</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberius solum fertilioremve segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: fertilior seges est alienis semper in agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 349</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae fertilissima sunt Germaniae loca circum Hercyniam silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14 praef.</bibl></cit> § 5.—</sense><sense id="n17995.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferre possum multos fertiles agros alios aliorum fructuum,</quote> <trans><tr>fertile</tr>, <tr>some in one kind of produce</tr>, <tr>some in another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager frugum fertilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fertilis hominum frugumque Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus frugum pecorisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:29" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare testae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae pabuli tantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arenae vitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incolae (Taprobanes) auri margaritarumque grandium fertiliores quam Indi,</quote> <trans><tr>richer in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17995.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager a litore arboribus fertilis, intus frugibus tantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17995.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus fertilis ad omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 190</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna a sacro numquam non fertilis igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Aetna, 556" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Aetna, 556</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17995.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fertile pectus habes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacche, soles Phoebo fertilis esse tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 76: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto priscorum cura fertilior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14 praef.</bibl></cit> § 3.—</sense><sense id="n17995.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That makes fruitful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertilizing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): dea (i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ceres</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 642</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <pb n="741" /> <cb n="FERU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:608" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 608</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores fertilissimum in agro oculum domini esse dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fertĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fruitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">derelicta (metalla) fertilius revivescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 49, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fertilitas: <entryFree id="n17996" type="main" key="ferti^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fertilis</etym>, <sense id="n17996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n17996.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of plants and animals (class.): quae sit vel sterilitas agrorum vel fertilitas futura, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae (Siculae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum et vitium olearumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 138</bibl></cit>. —Of animal fruitfulness: <cit><quote lang="la">(Rhea) indoluit fertilitate suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:202" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 202</bibl></cit>: barbara, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the Oriental women</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium ad generandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17996.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis ejus (Protogenis) summa intentio, et ideo minor fertilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fertiliter: <entryFree id="n17997" type="main" key="ferti^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fertilis <sense id="n17997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fertor: <entryFree id="n17998" type="main" key="fertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fero</etym>, <sense id="n17998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who bears</hi>, not in use; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 57</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fertorius: <entryFree id="n17999" type="main" key="ferto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fertor</etym>, <sense id="n17999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carrying</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n17999.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella,</quote> <trans><tr>a sedan-chair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n17999.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fertōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sedan-chair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fertum: <entryFree id="n18000" type="main" key="fertum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ferct-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of oblation-cake</hi>, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">141, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:48" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fertus: <entryFree id="n18001" type="main" key="fertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fero; cf. fertilis</etym>, <sense id="n18001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Or. Mar. 556</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Descr. Orb. 1205</bibl>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 258</bibl>, recent edd. read effertus, ex. conj. Lachm.)</sense></entryFree>
ferula: <entryFree id="n18002" type="main" key="fe^ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant fennel-giant</hi>, Ferula, Linn., <hi rend="ital">in the pith of which Prometheus is feigned to have preserved the fire which he stole from heaven.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18002.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 144" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18002.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18002.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The thin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slender branch</hi> of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18002.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">walkingstick</hi> (for syn. cf.: baculum, bacillum, scipio, fustis; <cit><quote lang="la">virga),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 123</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18002.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A whip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rod</hi>, to punish slaves or schoolboys, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:479" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 479</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:80" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:10" default="NO">10, 62, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 224</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for driving draught cattle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 546</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18002.6" n="D" level="2"> As an attribute of Silvanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18002.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A splint</hi> for broken bones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18002.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The young stag's horn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ferulaceus: <entryFree id="n18003" type="main" key="fe^ru^la_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrŭlācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferula</etym>. <sense id="n18003.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of fennel-giant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18003.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling fennel-giant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 62, § 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferulago: <entryFree id="n18004" type="main" key="fe^ru^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrŭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior species of fennel-giant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:12:84" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 12, 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ferularis: <entryFree id="n18005" type="main" key="fe^ru^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fennel-giant</hi>, Gargil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:de Arb. Pomif. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> de Arb. Pomif. 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
feruleus: <entryFree id="n18006" type="main" key="fe^ru^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n18006.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Made of fennel-giant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18006.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Resembling fennel-giant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ferumen: <entryFree id="n18007" type="main" key="fe_ru_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fērūmen</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fērūmĭno</orth>, etc., v. ferrumen, etc.</entryFree>
ferus: <entryFree id="n18008" type="main" key="fe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qh/r</foreign>, Aeol. <foreign lang="greek">fh/r</foreign>; Lat. ferox, etc.; v. ferio</etym>, <sense id="n18008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untamed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18008.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals and plants. </sense><sense id="n18008.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (syn. immanis, opp. cicur): <cit><quote lang="la">quae vero et quam varia genera bestiarum vel cicurum vel ferarum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc apparet in bestiis, volucribus, nantibus, agrestibus, cicuribus, feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes (opp. cicures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanes et ferae beluae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera et immanis belua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palumbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 60</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor (with solitudinem redolens),</quote> <trans><tr>disagreeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18008.3" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18008.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wild animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild beast</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); <hi rend="ital">a lion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a boar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 818</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a stag</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 489</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 268</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18008.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (sc. bestia),<cb n="FERV" />  <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wild animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild beast</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">immani et vastae insidens beluae, quocumque vult, inflectit illam feram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 26, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ulla re longius absumus a natura ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae ferae nullo insequente saepe incidunt (in plagas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa in ea (silva Hercynia) genera ferarum nasci constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque homini neque ferae parcunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidolosae dum latent silvis ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulea fera,</quote> <trans><tr>the she-wolf that suckled Romulus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 104</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a sea-monster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 713</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">719</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:42" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 42</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the ant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl>; the constellations of the <hi rend="ital">Great</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Little Bear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna minorque ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Tr. 4:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 20</bibl>.— Prov.: ferae inter se placidae sunt, morsuque similium abstinent, Sen. de lra, 2, 8, 3.—</sense><sense id="n18008.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of places (syn. incultus): <cit><quote lang="la">in locis feris arbores plura ferunt, in his, quae sunt culta, meliora,</quote> <trans><tr>wild</tr>, <tr>uncultivated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: ferus, ager incultus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=86" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 86</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 92</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18008.7" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncultivated; savage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barbarous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cruel</hi> (syn.: immanis, agrestis, inhumanus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. mansuetus, humanus): ipsis in hominibus nulla gens est neque tam mansueta neque tam fera, quae non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla gens tam fera, nemo omnium tam immanis, cujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex feris et immanibus mites reddidit et mansuetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus atque agrestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhumani ac feri testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus et ferreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ferus et vere ferreus ille fuit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. ferreus: nemo adeo ferus est, ut non mitescere possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni hospitibus feri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iberia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi hominum, studiis bellandi jam immanes ac feri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 33</bibl> (Rep. 2, 23 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium immansuetum ferumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(ostendere ejus) mores feros immanemque naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines a fera agrestique vita ad hunc humanum cultum civilemque deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenera militiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diluvies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra (of death by sacrifice),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores lenire requie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 317</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: ferum visu dictuque (= <foreign lang="greek">deino\n i)dei=n kai\ le/gein</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:175" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 175</bibl>.—No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fervefacio: <entryFree id="n18009" type="main" key="ferve^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n18009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in tmesi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea ferve bene facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 9</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ferveo + facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">melt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem addito et oleum, postea fervefacito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patinae sese fervefaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix fervefacta,</quote> <trans><tr>melted pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7</bibl></cit>. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fervefacta jacula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fervens: <entryFree id="n18010" type="main" key="fervens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from ferveo.</entryFree>
ferventer: <entryFree id="n18011" type="main" key="ferventer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ferventer</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ferveo, <sense id="n18011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ferveo: <entryFree id="n18012" type="main" key="ferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervĕo</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 2</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fervo</orth>, <itype>vi, 3</itype> (the latter form ante-and post-class., <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Pseud. 3, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 41 al.</bibl>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> in class. per., e.g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 677</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 32</bibl>; <sense id="n18012.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">not in Hor.: si quis antiquos secutus fervĕre brevi media syllaba dicat, deprehendatur vitiose loqui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">fru</foreign>-, to wave, flicker; Sanscr. bhur-, be restless; cf. <foreign lang="greek">fre/ar</foreign>, Germ. Brunnen, Lat. fretum; v. Fick, Vergl. Wört. p. 140; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 304" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 304</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be boiling hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ferment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi> (class.; most freq. in poets.; syn.: calere, aestuare, ebullire, ardescere, ignescere; ardere, flagrare, tepere). </sense><sense id="n18012.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18012.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form ferveo: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliqua jam parte mustum excoctum in se fervebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque immundis fervent allata popinis,</quote> <trans><tr>steam</tr>, <tr>smoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacas bullire facies: et ubi diu ferbuerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemptusque testa, Qua modo ferbuerat Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:16" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus domini fervet vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form fervo: fervit aqua et fervet: fervit nunc, fervet ad annum, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl>: quando (ahenum) fervit, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 503, 5</bibl>: facite<cb n="FERV" />  ut ignis fervat, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea ferve bene facito (brassicam): ubi ferverit, in catinum indito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol fervit,</quote> <trans><tr>is hot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.4" n="(g)" level="5"> In an uncertain form; <cit><quote lang="la">ferventem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 18, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. </sense><sense id="n18012.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To boil up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne Excitat (turbo) ingenti sonitu mare, fervĕre cogens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tunc pariter vento nimbisque videbis Ferĕre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 456</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be in a ferment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swarm with numbers; to come forth in great numbers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swarm forth</hi>: fervĕre piratis vastarique omnia circum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 503, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marte Fervĕre Leucaten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 677</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opere omnis semita fervet ... Quosque dabas gemitus, cum litora fervĕre late Prospiceres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 407</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">fora litibus omnia fervent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:64:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 64, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte tuas legiones per loca campi fervere cum videas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervere classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>; Att. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=78" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 78</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 483 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fervent examina putri De bove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:379" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:588" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 588</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:317" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 317</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:243 al" default="NO">9, 243 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18012.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to burn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be heated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agitated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rave.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18012.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Form ferveo: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo fervet efferturque avaritia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fervet avaritiā miseroque cupidine pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fervent multo linguaque corque mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:732" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 732</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus tumida fervebat ab ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervet immensusque ruit profundo Pindarus ore,</quote> <trans><tr>rages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: fervet opus redolentque thymo fragrantia mella, <hi rend="ital">glows</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is carried on briskly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Aetna, 167" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Aetna, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter vos libertorumque cohortem Pugna fervet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus cui plurima palma fervet,</quote> <trans><tr>shines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 59</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: sceptrumque capessere fervet, <hi rend="ital">burns</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">eagerly desires</hi>, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 295</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna secare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Gild. 350</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Form fervo: heu cor irā fervit caecum, amentiā rapior ferorque, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 503, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fervit maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 866</bibl> P.): hoc nunc fervit animus, hoc volo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 503, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus haec fervit flagiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 8" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se fervere caede Lacaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:150" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 150</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem fervere caede novā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 693</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: quanta vociferatione fervitur! Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 25</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fervens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">boiling hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18012.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">foculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferventissima aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 21</bibl></cit>: ferventes fusili ex argilla glandes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotae,</quote> <trans><tr>swift</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:199" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 199</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>shining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:74:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 74, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cinere ferventi leniter decoquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 50, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa vapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictamnum fervens et acre gustu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>smoking</tr>, <tr>warm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferventia caedibus arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:483" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fluvius) Spumeus et fervens,</quote> <trans><tr>raging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus modesto sanguine,</quote> <trans><tr>glowing</tr>, <tr>blushing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:300" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 300</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ferventia os intus exusserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of sound, <hi rend="ital">hissing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sono) resultante in duris, fervente in umidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 80, 82, § 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18012.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis animus et magnus in homine non perfecto nec sapiente ferventior plerumque est,</quote> <trans><tr>too ardent and impetuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: ferventes latrones, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale fuit Cassi rapido ferventius amni Ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>impetuous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum Fervens difficili bile tumet jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervens ira oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>sparkling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero fervens,</quote> <trans><tr>drunken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:283" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 283</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re ferventissima friges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ferventer</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hotly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warmly</hi>: ferventer loqui, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferventissime concerpi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferventius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Genes. ad Lit. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Genes. ad Lit. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fervesco: <entryFree id="n18013" type="main" key="fervesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [ferveo], <hi rend="ital">to become boiling hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin to boil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18013.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">possent seriae fervescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervescens materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa pars corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus mobilitate sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum validis fervescunt viribus undae,</quote> <trans><tr>boil up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 491</bibl></cit>.— —* </sense><sense id="n18013.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) in ira cum fervescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 289</bibl></cit>. <pb n="742" /> <cb n="FESS" /></sense></entryFree>
fervidus: <entryFree id="n18014" type="main" key="fervi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fervor</etym>, <sense id="n18014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glowing hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi> (class.; syn.: tepidus, calidus, ignĕus). </sense><sense id="n18014.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarta pars mundi (i. e. ignis) tota natura fervida est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 407</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <trans><tr>sultry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>raging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba sapore acri et fervido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 11, 44, § 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18014.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">glowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">florente juventā Fervidus (opp. senex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer (i. e. Cupido),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervidus ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 485</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis fraternae fervidus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 736</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitā spe fervidus ardet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervidus ingenii Masinissa et fervidus aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepropera ac fervida ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervidi animi vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 52, 7</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <trans><tr>fiery</tr>, <tr>eager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervidum quoddam et petulans et furiosum genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:241" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 241</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fervida oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 83, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appii volubilis et paulo fervidior erat oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 894</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fervo: <entryFree id="n18015" type="main" key="fervo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. ferveo.</entryFree>
fervor: <entryFree id="n18016" type="main" key="fervor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fervor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ferveo</etym>, <sense id="n18016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boiling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raging heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a violent heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fermenting</hi> (class.; syn.: ardor, tepor, calor, aestus). </sense><sense id="n18016.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pollens fervore corusco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 237</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 856</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi ille fervor purior, perlucidior mobiliorque multo quam hic noster calor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit calido febrim fervore coörtam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 104</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput incensum fervore gerebant,</quote> <trans><tr>a raging heat</tr>, <tr>fever heat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis venti fervorem mirum concinnat in undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 437</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 461</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 215</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 605</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:611" default="NO" valid="yes">611</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">medii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>noontide heat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 4, 5, § 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18016.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic fervor concitatioque animi inveteraverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fervor mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat quidam fervor aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fervore carentes anni (i. e. senectus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:25" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel icto Accessit fervor capiti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>intoxication</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: maris, <hi rend="ital">an excited</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">disturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsafe condition of the sea</hi> (caused by pirates), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 31</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vitiorum fervoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fescemnoe: <entryFree id="n18017" type="gloss" key="fescemnoe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fescemnoe</orth> <itype>vocabantur, qui depellere fascinum credebantur</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=86" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 86</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fescennia: <entryFree id="n18018" type="main" key="Fescenni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 695</bibl>), <sense id="n18018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient but small city of Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Falerii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for a sort of sportive and jeering dialogues in verse named after it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>; Serv. l. l.; v. Dennis, Etrur. 1, p. 152 sq. (acc. to Gell. and Müll. the modern Civita Castellana; acc. to Dennis, near Borghetto).—</sense><sense id="n18018.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fescennia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fescennine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fescennina per hunc inventa licentia morem Versibus alternis opprobria rustica fudit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=85" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 85</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">locutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an amphimacer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Fescennine verses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fescennines</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> p. 252 Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 86</bibl>.—Also. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescen-nīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. carmina, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cont. Symm. 1, 261</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 914</bibl> (the derivation of these Fescennini from fascinum seems improbable).—</sense><sense id="n18018.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fe-scennīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lampooner</hi>: spatiator atque Fescenninus, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. spatiatorem, p. 344 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fescenninicola: <entryFree id="n18019" type="main" key="Fescenni_ni^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennīnĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Fescenninus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n18019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of Fescennine verses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 21, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fescenninus: <entryFree id="n18020" type="main" key="Fescenni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Fescennia, II.</entryFree>
fescennium: <entryFree id="n18021" type="main" key="Fescenni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fescennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Fescennia <sense id="n18021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fessonia: <entryFree id="n18022" type="main" key="Fesso_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fessōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fessus</etym>, <sense id="n18022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of weary persons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 4:21" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 4, 21</bibl>. <cb n="FEST" /></sense></entryFree>
fessulus: <entryFree id="n18023" type="hapax" key="fessu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fessŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n18023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [fessus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat wearied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Anech. 19</bibl></cit> (p. 352 ed. Hildebr. min.).</sense></entryFree>
fessus: <entryFree id="n18024" type="main" key="fessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. hā-, gahāmi, relinquo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xi=ros, xh=ra, xwri/s</foreign>; Lat. ad-fatim, fatigo</etym>, <sense id="n18024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatigued; worn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infirm</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in poets; syn.: fatigatus, defessus, lassus, languidus). </sense><sense id="n18024.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani quamquam itinere atque opere castrorum et proelio fessi lassique erant, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de via fessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessum inedia fluctibusque recreare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientes bello fessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiā fessae cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plorando fessus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiate videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1038</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curāque viāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 596</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 440</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessi vomere tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti fessi aegritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercito corpore fessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:70:2" default="NO" valid="yes">70, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi librum Sollicito damus aut fesso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde Rubos fessi pervenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">viator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graii (sc. bello),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18024.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fessi rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>exhausted with events</tr>, <tr>misfortunes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessus bellique viaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:395" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidi rerum fessique salutis,</quote> <trans><tr>despairing of safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:234" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 234</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina fessa gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:40" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18024.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">alter fessum vulnere, fessum cursu trahens corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 848</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Phoebus) qui salutari levat arte fessos Corporis artus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sick</tr>, <tr>diseased</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Carm. Sec. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox fessa loquendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessa aetas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the weakness of age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessa aetate Galbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus aetatis spatio ne fessa vetusto Obruat,</quote> <trans><tr>worn out</tr>, <tr>decayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 774</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 308</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cardines fessi et turbati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amnes) In mare deducunt fessas erroribus undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 168</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 519</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 393</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 748</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 19: fessa dies, <hi rend="ital">spent</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">drawing to a close</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessae res,</quote> <trans><tr>critical</tr>, <tr>precarious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>misfortunes</tr>, <tr>calamities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus succurite fessis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deligendum esse qui fessis rebus succurreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
festatus: <entryFree id="n18025" type="hapax" key="festa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>festus</etym>, <sense id="n18025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dressed in festal attire</hi>: Dialis quotidie festatus est, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
festice: <entryFree id="n18026" type="hapax" key="festi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>festus, <hi rend="ital">festively</hi>, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n18026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joyously</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 452, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
festinabundus: <entryFree id="n18027" type="main" key="festi_na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>festino</etym>, <sense id="n18027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
festinans: <entryFree id="n18028" type="main" key="festi_nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. festino.</entryFree>
festinanter: <entryFree id="n18029" type="main" key="festi_nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, v. festino <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
festinatim: <entryFree id="n18030" type="main" key="festi_na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>festino</etym>, <sense id="n18030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi> (ante-class. for festinanter): Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0646,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>Sisenn.</author> ib. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
festinatio: <entryFree id="n18031" type="main" key="festi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnātĭo</orth> <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speed</hi> (class., in the <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid haec tanta celeritas festinatioque significat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea festinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola plena festinationis et pulveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni festinatione properare in patriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus festinationis an otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 211</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium festinatione praeripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoscas velim huic festinationi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (rei) festinationem mihi tollis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praematura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum est ne in festinationibus suscipiamus nimias celeritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
festinato: <entryFree id="n18032" type="main" key="festi_na_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. festino <sense id="n18032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
festinis: <entryFree id="n18033" type="main" key="festi_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. festinus <sense id="n18033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
festino: <entryFree id="n18034" type="main" key="festi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qei/nw</foreign>; Lat. -fendo in defendo, offendo, -festus in manifestus, etc., and fustis, Corss. Ausspr. 2, 190; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 255" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 255</bibl>]. </sense><sense id="n18034.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make haste</hi>, <cb n="FEST" /> <hi rend="ital">hurry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be quick</hi> (class.; not in Caes.; syn.: propero, celero, maturo): aliud est properare, aliud festinare. Qui unum quid mature transigit, is properat: qui multa simul incipit neque perficit, is festinat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:14:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 14, 2</bibl>; id. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. properare, p. 235 Müll.; ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 441, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propemodum quid illic festinet sentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aput nos eccillam festinat cum sorore uxor tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid festinas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam festinas, non est mora longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 35</bibl></cit>; Sall. Fragm. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:4"
